title: The command to one who becomes sleepy while praying, or who starts to falter in his recitation of the Qur’an or statements of remembrance, to lie down or sit down until that goes away
title_ar: باب أَمْرِ مَنْ نَعَسَ فِي صَلاَتِهِ أَوِ اسْتَعْجَمَ عَلَيْهِ الْقُرْآنُ أَوِ الذِّكْرُ بِأَنْ يَرْقُدَ أَوْ يَقْعُدَ حَتَّى يَذْهَبَ عَنْهُ ذَلِكَ

title: The book of the virtues of the Qur’an etc
title_ar: باب فَضَائِلِ الْقُرْآنِ وَمَا يَتَعَلَّقُ بِهِ

title: The command to keep refreshing one’s knowledge of the Qur’an and that it is disliked to say I have forgotten such-and-such a verse, but it is permissible to say I have been caused to forget
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِتَعَهُّدِ الْقُرْآنِ وَكَرَاهَةِ قَوْلِ نَسِيتُ آيَةَ كَذَا. وَجَوَازِ قَوْلِ أُنْسِيتُهَا

title: It is recommended to make one’s voice beautiful when reciting Qur’an
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَحْسِينِ الصَّوْتِ بِالْقُرْآنِ ‏

title: Mentioning the recitation of the Prophet (ﷺ) of Surat al-Fath on the day of the conquest of Makkah
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ قِرَاءَةِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم سُورَةَ الْفَتْحِ يَوْمَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ ‏‏

title: The descent of tranquility (sakinah) when the Qur’an is recited
title_ar: باب نُزُولِ السَّكِينَةِ لِقِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ ‏

title: The virtue of the one who memorizes the Qur’an
title_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ حَافِظِ الْقُرْآنِ ‏

title: The virtue of the one who is skilled in reciting Qur’an and the one who falters in reciting
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْمَاهِرِ بِالْقُرْآنِ وَالَّذِي يَتَتَعْتَعُ فِيهِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to recite the Qur’an to people of virtue who are skilled in its recitation, even if the reciter is better than the one to whom it is recited
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ قِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْفَضْلِ وَالْحُذَّاقِ فِيهِ وَإِنْ كَانَ الْقَارِئُ أَفْضَلَ مِنَ الْمَقْرُوءِ عَلَيْهِ

title: The virtue of listening to the Qur’an, asking one who has memorized it to recite so that one may listen, weeping when reciting, and pondering the meanings
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ اسْتِمَاعِ الْقُرْآنِ وَطَلَبِ الْقِرَاءَةِ مِنْ حَافِظِهِ لِلاِسْتِمَاعِ وَالْبُكَاءِ عِنْدَ الْقِرَاءَةِ وَالتَّدَبُّرِ

title: The virtue of reciting the Qur’an in prayer and learning it
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ قِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ وَتَعَلُّمِهِ ‏

title: The virtue of reciting the Qur’an and Surat al-Baqarah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ قِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ وَسُورَةِ الْبَقَرَةِ ‏

title: The virtue of al-Fatihah and the closing verse of Surat al-Baqarah; and the encouragement to recite the two verses at the end of Surat al-Baqarah
title_ar: اب فَضْلِ الْفَاتِحَةِ وَخَوَاتِيمِ سُورَةِ الْبَقَرَةِ وَالْحَثِّ عَلَى قِرَاءَةِ الآيَتَيْنِ مِنْ آخِرِ الْبَقَرَةِ

title: The virtue of Surat al-Kahf and Ayat al-Kursi
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ سُورَةِ الْكَهْفِ وَآيَةِ الْكُرْسِيِّ ‏

title: The virtue of reciting Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ قِرَاءَةِ ‏{‏ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ‏}‏ ‏

title: The virtue of reciting al-Mu`awwidhatain (the two surahs seeking refuge with Allah)
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ قِرَاءَةِ الْمُعَوِّذَتَيْنِ ‏

title: The virtue of one who acts in accordance with the Qur’an and teaches it. And the virtue of one who learns wisdom from Fiqh or other types of knowledge, then acts upon it and teaches it
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ مَنْ يَقُومُ بِالْقُرْآنِ وَيُعَلِّمُهُ وَفَضْلِ مَنْ تَعَلَّمَ حِكْمَةً مِنْ فِقْهٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ فَعَمِلَ بِهَا وَعَلَّمَهَا

title: The clarification that the Qur’an was revealed in seven ahruf (modes of recitation), and clarifying its meaning
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْقُرْآنَ عَلَى سَبْعَةِ أَحْرُفٍ وَبَيَانِ مَعْنَاهُ ‏

title: Slow, measured pace of recitation (tartil), and to not rush when reciting, and the permissibility of reciting two or more surahs in one rak`ah
title_ar: باب تَرْتِيلِ الْقِرَاءَةِ وَاجْتِنَابِ الْهَذِّ وَهُوَ الإِفْرَاطُ فِي السُّرْعَةِ وَإِبَاحَةِ سُورَتَيْنِ فَأَكْثَرَ فِي الرَّكْعَةِ

title: Concerning various recitations
title_ar: باب مَا يَتَعَلَّقُ بِالْقِرَاءَاتِ ‏

title: The times when it is forbidden to offer salat
title_ar: باب الأَوْقَاتِ الَّتِي نُهِيَ عَنِ الصَّلاَةِ، فِيهَا ‏.‏

title: How `Amr bin `Abasah became Muslim
title_ar: باب إِسْلاَمِ عَمْرِو بْنِ عَبَسَةَ ‏

title: Do not aim to pray when the sun is rising or setting
title_ar: باب لاَ تَتَحَرَّوْا بِصَلاَتِكُمْ طُلُوعَ الشَّمْسِ وَلاَ غُرُوبَهَا ‏‏

title: Concerning the two rak`ah that the Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray after `Asr
title_ar: باب مَعْرِفَةِ الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ اللَّتَيْنِ كَانَ يُصَلِّيهِمَا النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ بَعْدَ الْعَصْرِ

title: It is recommended to pray two rak`ah before Maghrib
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ رَكْعَتَيْنِ قَبْلَ صَلاَةِ الْمَغْرِبِ ‏

title: Between every two calls, there is a prayer
title_ar: باب بَيْنَ كُلِّ أَذَانَيْنِ صَلاَةٌ ‏

title: The fear prayer
title_ar: باب صَلاَةِ الْخَوْفِ ‏

title: Ghusl on Friday is obligatory for all adult men, and clarifying what they were ordered regarding it
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ غُسْلِ الْجُمُعَةِ عَلَى كُلِّ بَالِغٍ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ وَبَيَانِ مَا أُمِرُوا بِهِ ‏

title: Perfume and siwak on Fridays
title_ar: باب الطِّيبِ وَالسِّوَاكِ يَوْمَ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: Listening attentively to the Khutbah on Friday
title_ar: باب فِي الإِنْصَاتِ يَوْمَ الْجُمُعَةِ فِي الْخُطْبَةِ ‏

title: The (special) time that occurs on Friday
title_ar: باب فِي السَّاعَةِ الَّتِي فِي يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: The virtue of Friday
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ

title: This Ummah has been guided to Friday
title_ar: باب هِدَايَةِ هَذِهِ الأُمَّةِ لِيَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: The virtue of going out early on Friday
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ التَّهْجِيرِ يَوْمَ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: The virtue of one who remains silent and listens attentively during the khutbah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ مَنِ اسْتَمَعَ وَأَنْصَتَ فِي الْخُطْبَةِ ‏

title: Jumu`ah prayer is when the sun has passed its zenith
title_ar: باب صَلاَةِ الْجُمُعَةِ حِينَ تَزُولُ الشَّمْسُ ‏

title: The two khutbah before the prayer, and sitting briefly in between them
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ الْخُطْبَتَيْنِ قَبْلَ الصَّلاَةِ وَمَا فِيهِمَا مِنَ الْجَلْسَةِ ‏

title: The verse: “And when they see some merchandise or some amusement they disperse headlong to it, and leave you standing”
title_ar: باب فِي قَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى: {وَإِذَا رَأَوْا تِجَارَةً أَوْ لَهْوًا انْفَضُّوا إِلَيْهَا وَتَرَكُوكَ قَائِمًا}

title: Stern warning against missing Jumu`ah
title_ar: باب التَّغْلِيظِ فِي تَرْكِ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: Keeping the prayer and khutbah short
title_ar: باب تَخْفِيفِ الصَّلاَةِ وَالْخُطْبَةِ ‏

title: Greeting (prayers upon entering the masjid) while the Imam is preaching
title_ar: باب التَّحِيَّةِ وَالإِمَامُ يَخْطُبُ ‏

title: The hadith about teaching during the khutbah
title_ar: باب حَدِيثِ التَّعْلِيمِ فِي الْخُطْبَةِ ‏

title: What is to be recited in Jumu`ah prayer
title_ar: باب مَا يُقْرَأُ فِي صَلاَةِ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: What is to be recited on Friday
title_ar: باب مَا يُقْرَأُ فِي يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: Prayer after Jumu`ah
title_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الْجُمُعَةِ ‏

title: It Is Permissible For Women To Go Out To The 'Id Prayer And Attend The Khutbah, Separated From The Men
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ إِبَاحَةِ خُرُوجِ النِّسَاءِ فِي الْعِيدَيْنِ إِلَى الْمُصَلَّى وَشُهُودِ الْخُطْبَةِ مُفَارِقَاتٌ لِلرِّجَالِ

title: Not Offering Any Other Prayer, Before Or After The 'Id Prayer At The Musalla (Prayer-Place)
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ الصَّلاَةِ قَبْلَ الْعِيدِ وَبَعْدَهَا فِي الْمُصَلَّى ‏

title: What Is To Be Recited In The 'Id Prayer?
title_ar: باب مَا يُقْرَأُ بِهِ فِي صَلاَةِ الْعِيدَيْنِ ‏

title: Concession Allowing Play That Involves No Disobedience During The Days Of 'Id
title_ar: باب الرُّخْصَةِ فِي اللَّعِبِ الَّذِي لاَ مَعْصِيَةَ فِيهِ فِي أَيَّامِ الْعِيدِ ‏

title: Raising The Hands In Supplication When Praying For Rain
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ بِالدُّعَاءِ فِي الاِسْتِسْقَاءِ ‏

title: The Supplication When Praying For Rain
title_ar: باب الدُّعَاءِ فِي الاِسْتِسْقَاءِ ‏

title: Seeking Refuge With Allah When Seeing Wind And Dark Clouds, And Rejoicing At The Rain
title_ar: باب التَّعَوُّذِ عِنْدَ رُؤْيَةِ الرِّيحِ وَالْغَيْمِ وَالْفَرَحِ بِالْمَطَرِ ‏‏

title: The East Wind And The West Wind
title_ar: باب فِي رِيحِ الصَّبَا وَالدَّبُورِ ‏‏

title: The Eclipse Prayer
title_ar: باب صَلاَةِ الْكُسُوفِ ‏

title: Mentioning The Punishment In The Grave During The Eclipse Prayer
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ فِي صَلاَةِ الْخُسُوفِ ‏

title: What Was Shown To The Prophet (ﷺ) Of Paradise And Hell During The Eclipse Prayer
title_ar: باب مَا عُرِضَ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فِي صَلاَةِ الْكُسُوفِ مِنْ أَمْرِ الْجَنَّةِ وَالنَّارِ

title: Those Who Say That He Prayed With Eight Bowings And Four Prostrations
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ مَنْ قَالَ إِنَّهُ رَكَعَ ثَمَانَ رَكَعَاتٍ فِي أَرْبَعِ سَجَدَاتٍ ‏

title: The Call For The Eclipse Prayer: "As-Salatu Jami'ah (The Prayer Is Being Assembled)
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ النِّدَاءِ بِصَلاَةِ الْكُسُوفِ ‏"‏ الصَّلاَةَ جَامِعَةً ‏"‏ ‏

title: Prompt the Dying person to say La Ilaha Ill-Allah
title_ar: باب تَلْقِينِ الْمَوْتَى لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ ‏

title: What should be said at times of calamity?
title_ar: باب مَا يُقَالُ عِنْدَ الْمُصِيبَةِ ‏

title: What is to be said in the presence of the sick and the dying
title_ar: باب مَا يُقَالُ عِنْدَ الْمَرِيضِ وَالْمَيِّتِ ‏

title: Closing the eyes of the deceased and supplicating for him, when he dies
title_ar: باب فِي إِغْمَاضِ الْمَيِّتِ وَالدُّعَاءِ لَهُ إِذَا حُضِرَ

title: The upward gaze of the deceased follows his soul
title_ar: باب فِي شُخُوصِ بَصَرِ الْمَيِّتِ يَتْبَعُ نَفْسَهُ ‏

title: Crying for the deceased
title_ar: باب الْبُكَاءِ عَلَى الْمَيِّتِ ‏

title: Visiting the sick
title_ar: باب فِي عِيَادَةِ الْمَرْضَى ‏

title: Patience in bearing calamity when it first strikes
title_ar: باب فِي الصَّبْرِ عَلَى الْمُصِيبَةِ عِنْدَ الصَّدْمَةِ الأُولَى ‏

title: The deceased is tormented because of his family's crying for him
title_ar: باب الْمَيِّتُ يُعَذَّبُ بِبُكَاءِ أَهْلِهِ عَلَيْهِ ‏

title: Stern warning against wailing
title_ar: باب التَّشْدِيدِ فِي النِّيَاحَةِ

title: Prohibition of women attending funerals
title_ar: باب نَهْىِ النِّسَاءِ عَنِ اتِّبَاعِ الْجَنَائِزِ، ‏

title: Washing the deceased
title_ar: باب فِي غَسْلِ الْمَيِّتِ ‏

title: Shrouding the deceased
title_ar: باب فِي كَفَنِ الْمَيِّتِ ‏

title: Covering the deceased
title_ar: باب تَسْجِيَةِ الْمَيِّتِ ‏

title: Shrouding the deceased well
title_ar: باب فِي تَحْسِينِ كَفَنِ الْمَيِّتِ ‏

title: Hastening with the funeral
title_ar: باب الإِسْرَاعِ بِالْجَنَازَةِ ‏

title: The virtue of offering the funeral prayer and following the bier
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْجَنَازَةِ وَاتِّبَاعِهَا ‏

title: If one hundred (people) pray for a person, they will intercede for him
title_ar: باب مَنْ صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ مِائَةٌ شُفِّعُوا فِيهِ ‏

title: If forty people pray for a person, they will intercede for him
title_ar: باب مَنْ صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ أَرْبَعُونَ شُفِّعُوا فِيهِ ‏‏

title: The deceased who is spoken well of and the one who is spoken badly of
title_ar: باب فِيمَنْ يُثْنَى عَلَيْهِ خَيْرٌ أَوْ شَرٌّ مِنَ الْمَوْتَى ‏‏

title: What was narrated concerning one who finds relief and one from whom relief is found
title_ar: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي ‏"‏ مُسْتَرِيحٌ وَمُسْتَرَاحٌ مِنْهُ ‏"‏ ‏‏

title: Saying the takbir over the deceased
title_ar: باب فِي التَّكْبِيرِ عَلَى الْجَنَازَةِ ‏‏

title: Praying over the grave
title_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْقَبْرِ ‏‏

title: Standing for funerals
title_ar: باب الْقِيَامِ لِلْجَنَازَةِ ‏‏

title: Abrogation of standing for funerals
title_ar: باب نَسْخِ الْقِيَامِ لِلْجَنَازَةِ ‏‏

title: Supplicating for the deceased during the (funeral) prayer
title_ar: باب الدُّعَاءِ لِلْمَيِّتِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ ‏‏

title: Where the Imam should stand in relation to the deceased when performing the funeral prayer
title_ar: باب أَيْنَ يَقُومُ الإِمَامُ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ لِلصَّلاَةِ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: Riding back after the funeral
title_ar: باب رُكُوبِ الْمُصَلِّي عَلَى الْجَنَازَةِ إِذَا انْصَرَفَ ‏‏

title: The Lahd (Niche), and setting up bricks over the deceased
title_ar: باب فِي اللَّحْدِ وَنَصْبِ اللَّبِنِ عَلَى الْمَيِّتِ ‏‏

title: Putting a piece of velvet in the grave
title_ar: باب جَعْلِ الْقَطِيفَةِ فِي الْقَبْرِ ‏‏

title: The command to level the grave
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِتَسْوِيَةِ الْقَبْرِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of plastering graves or erecting structures over them
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ تَجْصِيصِ الْقَبْرِ، وَالْبِنَاءِ، عَلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: Prohibition against sitting and praying on graves
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْجُلُوسِ، عَلَى الْقَبْرِ وَالصَّلاَةِ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: Offering the funeral prayer in the masjid
title_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْجَنَازَةِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ ‏‏

title: What is to be said when entering the graveyard and supplicating for its occupants
title_ar: باب مَا يُقَالُ عِنْدَ دُخُولِ الْقُبُورِ وَالدُّعَاءِ لأَهْلِهَا ‏‏

title: The prophet (ﷺ) asked his Lord for permission to visit the grave of his mother
title_ar: باب اسْتِئْذَانِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم رَبَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ فِي زِيَارَةِ قَبْرِ أُمِّهِ ‏‏

title: Leaving the funeral prayer for one who committed suicide
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْقَاتِلِ نَفْسَهُ ‏‏

title: There is No Zakat due on less than five Wasq
title_ar: باب لَيْسَ فِيمَا دُونَ خَمْسَةِ أَوْسُقٍ صَدَقَةٌ ‏‏

title: On what one-tenth or half of one-tenth is due
title_ar: باب مَا فِيهِ الْعُشْرُ أَوْ نِصْفُ الْعُشْرِ ‏‏

title: The Muslim is not obliged to give Zakat on his slave nor his horse
title_ar: باب لاَ زَكَاةَ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ فِي عَبْدِهِ وَفَرَسِهِ ‏‏

title: Paying or withholding Zakat
title_ar: باب فِي تَقْدِيمِ الزَّكَاةِ وَمَنْعِهَا ‏‏

title: Zakat Al-Fitr is due from the muslims in the form of dates and barley
title_ar: باب زَكَاةِ الْفِطْرِ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِينَ مِنَ التَّمْرِ وَالشَّعِيرِ ‏‏

title: The command to pay Zakat Al-Fitr before the prayer
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِإِخْرَاجِ زَكَاةِ الْفِطْرِ قَبْلَ الصَّلاَةِ ‏‏

title: The sin of one who withholds Zakat
title_ar: باب إِثْمِ مَانِعِ الزَّكَاةِ ‏‏

title: Pleasing the Su'ah (Zakat Collectors)
title_ar: باب إِرْضَاءِ السُّعَاةِ ‏‏

title: Severe Punishment for the one who does not pay Zakat
title_ar: باب تَغْلِيظِ عُقُوبَةِ مَنْ لاَ يُؤَدِّي الزَّكَاةَ ‏‏

title: Encouragement to give Charity
title_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي الصَّدَقَةِ ‏‏

title: Stern warning concerning those who hoard wealth
title_ar: باب فِي الْكَنَّازِينَ لِلأَمْوَالِ وَالتَّغْلِيظِ عَلَيْهِمْ ‏‏

title: Encouragement to spend and glad tidings of compensation for the one who spends on good deeds
title_ar: باب الْحَثِّ عَلَى النَّفَقَةِ وَتَبْشِيرِ الْمُنْفِقِ بِالْخَلَفِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of spending on one's family and slaves, and the sin of the one who neglects them or withholds maintenance from them
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ النَّفَقَةِ عَلَى الْعِيَالِ وَالْمَمْلُوكِ وَإِثْمِ مَنْ ضَيَّعَهُمْ أَوْ حَبَسَ نَفَقَتَهُمْ عَنْهُمْ

title: Starting with oneself, then one's family, then one's relatives, when spending
title_ar: باب الاِبْتِدَاءِ فِي النَّفَقَةِ بِالنَّفْسِ ثُمَّ أَهْلِهِ ثُمَّ الْقَرَابَةِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of spending and giving charity to relatives, spuses, children and parents, even if they are idolaters
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ النَّفَقَةِ وَالصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى الْأَقْرَبِينَ وَالزَّوْجِ وَالْأَوْلَادِ وَالْوَالِدَيْنِ وَلَوْ كَانُوا مُشْرِكِينَ

title: Charity given on behalf of the deceased will reach him
title_ar: باب وُصُولِ ثَوَابِ الصَّدَقَةِ عَنِ الْمَيِّتِ، إِلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: The word charity (Sadaqah) may apply to all good deeds Ma'ruf
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ اسْمَ الصَّدَقَةِ يَقَعُ عَلَى كُلِّ نَوْعٍ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ ‏‏

title: The one who spends and the one who withholds
title_ar: باب فِي الْمُنْفِقِ وَالْمُمْسِكِ ‏‏

title: Encouragement to give charity before there is no one to accept it
title_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي الصَّدَقَةِ قَبْلَ أَنْ لاَ يُوجَدَ مَنْ يَقْبَلُهَا ‏‏

title: Acceptance of charity that comes from good (Tayyib) earnings, and the growth thereof
title_ar: باب قَبُولِ الصَّدَقَةِ مِنَ الْكَسْبِ الطَّيِّبِ وَتَرْبِيَتِهَا ‏‏

title: Encouragement to give charity even if it is with half a date or a kind word. And charity is a shield against the fire.
title_ar: باب الْحَثِّ عَلَى الصَّدَقَةِ وَلَوْ بِشِقِّ تَمْرَةٍ أَوْ كَلِمَةٍ طَيِّبَةٍ وَأَنَّهَا حِجَابٌ مِنْ النَّارِ

title: Carrying goods for payment and giving charity out of one's wages, and the stern prohibition of belittling the one who gives something small in charity
title_ar: باب الْحَمْلِ بِأُجْرَةٍ يُتَصَدَّقُ بِهَا وَالنَّهْىِ الشَّدِيدِ عَنْ تَنْقِيصِ الْمُتَصَدِّقِ بِقَلِيل

title: The virute of giving gifts
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْمَنِيحَةِ ‏‏

title: The Likeness of the giver and the miser
title_ar: باب مَثَلِ الْمُنْفِقِ وَالْبَخِيلِ ‏‏

title: Confirmation of the reward of the one who gives Charity, even if the Charity ends up in the hands of an evildoer, and the like
title_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ أَجْرِ الْمُتَصَدِّقِ وَإِنْ وَقَعَتِ الصَّدَقَةُ فِي يَدِ غَيْرِ أَهْلِهَا ‏‏

title: The reward of the Trustworthy Trustee, and if a woman gives charity from her husband's house without causing any damage, with his explicit or implicit permission
title_ar: باب أَجْرِ الْخَازِنِ الأَمِينِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ إِذَا تَصَدَّقَتْ مِنْ بَيْتِ زَوْجِهَا غَيْرَ مُفْسِدَةٍ ب

title: What a slave spends of his master's wealth
title_ar: باب مَا أَنْفَقَ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ مَالِ مَوْلاَهُ ‏‏

title: The virtue of the one who does other kinds of good deeds in addition to giving charity
title_ar: باب مَنْ جَمَعَ الصَّدَقَةَ وَأَعْمَالَ الْبِرِّ ‏‏

title: Encouragement to spend, and it is disliked to count how much
title_ar: باب الْحَثِّ فِي الإِنْفَاقِ وَكَرَاهَةِ الإِحْصَاءِ ‏‏

title: Encouragement to give in charity even if it is a little, and a little should not be withheld because one thinks it is too little
title_ar: باب الْحَثِّ عَلَى الصَّدَقَةِ وَلَوْ بِالْقَلِيلِ وَلاَ تُمْتَنَعُ مِنَ الْقَلِيلِ لاِحْتِقَارِهِ ‏

title: The virtue of concealing (what is given in) charity
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ إِخْفَاءِ الصَّدَقَةِ ‏

title: The best of charity is that which is given when one is healthy and inclined to be stingy
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ أَفْضَلَ الصَّدَقَةِ صَدَقَةُ الصَّحِيحِ الشَّحِيحِ ‏

title: The upper hand is better than the lower hand, and the upper hand is the one that gives and the lower hand is the one that receives
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْيَدَ الْعُلْيَا خَيْرٌ مِنْ الْيَدِ السُّفْلَى وَأَنَّ الْيَدَ الْعُلْيَا هِيَ الْمُنْفِقَةُ وَأَنَّ السُّفْلَى هِيَ الْآخِذَةُ

title: The prohibition of Begging
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ ‏

title: The poor person who cannot find enough to make him independent of means, but the people do not realize that he is in need, so they do not give Charity to him
title_ar: باب الْمِسْكِينِ الَّذِي لاَ يَجِدُ غِنًى وَلاَ يُفْطَنُ لَهُ فَيُتَصَدَّقَ عَلَيْهِ ‏

title: It is disliked to beg from people
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ لِلنَّاسِ ‏

title: The one for whom it is permissible to ask for help
title_ar: باب مَنْ تَحِلُّ لَهُ الْمَسْأَلَةُ ‏

title: It is permissible to take without asking for it or hoping for it
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الأَخْذِ لِمَنْ أُعْطِيَ مِنْ غَيْرِ مَسْأَلَةٍ وَلاَ إِشْرَافٍ ‏

title: It is disliked to be eager to acquire worldly gains
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْحِرْصِ عَلَى الدُّنْيَا ‏

title: If the Son of Adam had two valleys, he would desire a third
title_ar: باب لَوْ أَنَّ لاِبْنِ آدَمَ وَادِيَيْنِ لاَبْتَغَى ثَالِثًا ‏

title: The virtue of contentment and encouragement thereof
title_ar: باب لَيْسَ الْغِنَى عَنْ كَثْرَةِ الْعَرَضِ

title: Warning against being deceived by the splendor and luxury of this world
title_ar: باب تَخَوُّفِ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْ زَهْرَةِ الدُّنْيَا ‏

title: The virtue of refraining from asking and being patient and content
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ التَّعَفُّفِ وَالصَّبْرِ ‏

title: Sufficient provision and contentment
title_ar: باب فِي الْكَفَافِ وَالْقَنَاعَةِ ‏

title: Giving to those whose hearts have been inclined (towards Islam) and to those for whose faith there is fear if they are not given anything, and putting up with the one who asks rudely due to ignorance, and the Khawarij and rulings regarding them
title_ar: باب إِعْطَاءِ مَنْ سَأَلَ بِفُحْشٍ وَغِلْظَةٍ ‏

title: Giving to one whose faith one fears
title_ar: باب إِعْطَاءِ مَنْ يُخَافُ عَلَى إِيمَانِهِ ‏

title: Giving to those whose hearts have been inclined (towards Islam) and urging those whose faith is strong to show patience
title_ar: باب إِعْطَاءِ الْمُؤَلَّفَةِ قُلُوبُهُمْ عَلَى الإِسْلاَمِ وَتَصَبُّرِ مَنْ قَوِيَ إِيمَانُهُ ‏

title: The Khawarij and their attributes
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ الْخَوَارِجِ وَصِفَاتِهِمْ ‏

title: Exhortation to kill the Khawarij
title_ar: باب التَّحْرِيضِ عَلَى قَتْلِ الْخَوَارِجِ ‏

title: The Khawarij are the most evil of people and of all creation
title_ar: باب الْخَوَارِجُ شَرُّ الْخَلْقِ وَالْخَلِيقَةِ ‏

title: Zakat is forbidden for the messenger of Allah ﷺ and his family, and they are Banu Hashim and Banu Al-Muttalib, and no one else
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الزَّكَاةِ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ وَعَلَى آلِهِ وَهُمْ بَنُو هَاشِمٍ وَبَنُو الْمُطَّلِبِ دُونَ غَيْرِهِمْ

title: Not appointing the family of the prophet (ﷺ) in charge of charity
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ اسْتِعْمَالِ آلِ النَّبِيِّ عَلَى الصَّدَقَةِ ‏

title: Gifts are permissible for the Prophet (ﷺ) and Banu Hashim and Banu Al-Muttalib, even if the giver acquired it by way of charity. When the receipient takes possession of Charity, it is no longer described as charity, and it is permissible for anyone for whom charity is otherwise unlawful
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الْهَدِيَّةِ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَلِبَنِي هَاشِمٍ وَبَنِي الْمُطَّلِبِ

title: The prophet (ﷺ) accepted gifts but refused Charity
title_ar: باب قَبُولِ النَّبِيِّ الْهَدِيَّةَ وَرَدِّهِ الصَّدَقَةَ ‏‏

title: The supplication for the one who brings Charity
title_ar: باب الدُّعَاءِ لِمَنْ أَتَى بِصَدَقَتِهِ ‏‏

title: Pleasing the Zakat Collector unless he asks for something unlawful
title_ar: باب إِرْضَاءِ السَّاعِي مَا لَمْ يَطْلُبْ حَرَامًا ‏‏

title: The Virtues of the month of Ramadan
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ ‏‏

title: The obligation to fast Ramadan when the crescent is sighted, and to break the fast when the crescent is sighted, and that if it is cloudy at the beginning or end of the month, then the month should be completed as thirty days.
title_ar: بَاب وُجُوبِ صَوْمِ رَمَضَانَ لِرُؤْيَةِ الْهِلَالِ وَالْفِطْرِ لِرُؤْيَةِ الْهِلَالِ وَأَنَّهُ إِذَا غُمَّ فِي أَوَّلِهِ أَوْ آخِرِهِ أُكْمِلَتْ عِدَّةُ الشَّهْرِ ثَلَاثِينَ يَوْمًا

title: Do not start fasting one or two days before Ramadan
title_ar: باب لاَ تَقَدَّمُوا رَمَضَانَ بِصَوْمِ يَوْمٍ وَلاَ يَوْمَيْنِ ‏‏

title: The month may be twenty-nine days
title_ar: باب الشَّهْرُ يَكُونُ تِسْعًا وَعِشْرِينَ ‏‏

title: Each land has its own sighting of the moon, and if they see the crescent in one land, that does not necessarily apply to regions that are far away from it
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ لِكُلِّ بَلَدٍ رُؤْيَتَهُمْ وَأَنَّهُمْ إِذَا رَأَوْا الْهِلَالَ بِبَلَدٍ لَا يَثْبُتُ حُكْمُهُ لِمَا بَعُدَ عَنْهُمْ

title: Clarifying that it does not matter whether the crescent is large or small, for Allah, the Most High, causes it to appear for long enough that people can see it, and if it is cloudy then thirty days should be completed
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّهُ لَا اعْتِبَارَ بِكُبْرِ الْهِلَالِ وَصِغَرِهِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ تَعَالَى أَمَدَّهُ لِلرُّؤْيَةِ فَإِنْ غُمَّ فَلْيُكْمَلْ ثَلَاثُونَ

title: The meaning of the Prophet's words: "The two months of 'Id cannot both be incomplete"
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ مَعْنَى قَوْلِهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ شَهْرَا عِيدٍ لَا يَنْقُصَانِ

title: Clarifying that fasting begins at dawn, and a person may eat and other than that until dawn begins; And clarifying the dawn which has to do with the rulings concerning the beginning of fasting and the beginning of the time for the Subh Prayer, and other than that, which is the Second Dawn, which is called the True Dawn. The First Dawn, which is the False Dawn, has nothing to do with the rulings
title_ar: بَاب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الدُّخُولَ فِي الصَّوْمِ يَحْصُلُ بِطُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ وَأَنَّ لَهُ الْأَكْلَ وَغَيْرَهُ حَتَّى يَطْلُعَ الْفَجْرُ وَبَيَانِ صِفَةِ الْفَجْرِ الَّذِي تَتَعَلَّقُ بِهِ الْأَحْكَامُ مِنْ الدُّخُولِ فِي الصَّوْمِ وَدُخُولِ وَقْتِ صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ وَغَيْرِ ذَلِكَ

title: The virtue of sahur, which is recommended. It is recommended to delay it and to hasten the breaking of the fast
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ السُّحُورِ وَتَأْكِيدِ اسْتِحْبَابِهِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ تَأْخِيرِهِ وَتَعْجِيلِ الْفِطْرِ ‏‏

title: Clarifying the time for ending the fast and the end of the day
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ وَقْتِ انْقِضَاءِ الصَّوْمِ وَخُرُوجِ النَّهَارِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of Al-Wisal
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْوِصَالِ، فِي الصَّوْمِ ‏‏

title: Clarifying that Kissing when fasting is not unlawful for the one whose desire is not provoked by that
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْقُبْلَةَ فِي الصَّوْمِ لَيْسَتْ مُحَرَّمَةً عَلَى مَنْ لَمْ تُحَرِّكْ شَهْوَتَهُ ‏‏

title: The fasting is valid for the one who is Junub when dawn comes
title_ar: باب صِحَّةِ صَوْمِ مَنْ طَلَعَ عَلَيْهِ الْفَجْرُ وَهُوَ جُنُبٌ ‏‏

title: The strict prohibition of intercourse during the day in Ramadan for one who is fasting; And the obligation of offering major expiation and the definition thereof; And that it is obligatory for both the one who can afford it and the one who cannot afford it, and it remains an obligation for the one who cannot afford it until he has the means
title_ar: باب تَغْلِيظِ تَحْرِيمِ الْجِمَاعِ فِي نَهَارِ رَمَضَانَ عَلَى الصَّائِمِ وَوُجُوبِ الْكَفَّارَةِ الْكُبْرَى فِيهِ وبيانها وأنها تجب على الموسر والمعسر وتثبت في ذمة المعسر حتى يستطيع

title: It is permissible to fast or not to fast during Ramadan for one who is travelling for no sinful purpose, if his journey is two stages or further. But it is better for the one who is able to fast without suffering any harm to do so, and the one for whom it is difficult may break the fast
title_ar: باب جواز الصوم والفطر في شهر رمضان للمسافر في غير معصية إذا كان سفره مرحلتين فأكثر وأن الأفضل لمن أطاقه بلا ضرر أن يصوم ولمن يشق عليه أن يفطر

title: The reward of the one who does not fast when travelling if he does any tasks that are required
title_ar: باب أَجْرِ الْمُفْطِرِ فِي السَّفَرِ إِذَا تَوَلَّى الْعَمَلَ ‏‏

title: The choice between fasting and not fasting when travelling
title_ar: باب التَّخْيِيرِ فِي الصَّوْمِ وَالْفِطْرِ فِي السَّفَرِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended for the person performing Hajj in 'Arafat not to fast on the day of 'Arafah.
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْفِطْرِ لِلْحَاجِّ بِعَرَفَاتٍ يَوْمَ عَرَفَةَ ‏‏

title: Fasting on the day of Ashura'
title_ar: باب صَوْمِ يَوْمِ عَاشُورَاءَ ‏‏

title: Which day should be fasted for 'Ashura?
title_ar: باب أَىُّ يَوْمٍ يُصَامُ فِي عَاشُورَاءَ ‏‏

title: Whoever eats on'Ashura, let him refrain (from eating) for the rest of the day
title_ar: باب مَنْ أَكَلَ فِي عَاشُورَاءَ فَلْيَكُفَّ بَقِيَّةَ يَوْمِهِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of fasting on the two days of 'Id
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ صَوْمِ، يَوْمِ الْفِطْرِ وَيَوْمِ الأَضْحَى ‏‏

title: The prohibition of fasting the days of At-Tashriq, which are the days of eating, drinking and remembering Allah, The Mighty and Sublime
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ صَوْمِ أَيَّامِ التَّشْرِيقِ ‏

title: It is disliked to single out Friday for fasting, unless it coincides with a day that one customarily fasts
title_ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ صِيَامِ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ مُنْفَرِدًا

title: The Saying of Allah Most High: "... And as for those who can fast with difficulty, they have) a choice either to fast or) to feed a Miskin (poor person) (for every day)" is Abrogated by His saying: "... So whoever of you sights (the crescent on the first night of) the month (of Ramadan i.e. is present at his home), he must observe Sawm (fasts) that month"...
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ نَسْخِ قَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى ‏{‏ وَعَلَى الَّذِينَ يُطِيقُونَه} فِدْيَةٌ بِقَوْلِهِ فَمَنْ شَهِدَ مِنْكُمْ الشَّهْرَ فَلْيَصُمْهُ

title: It is Permissible to delay making up missed Ramadan Fasts until before the next Ramadan comes, and this is for those who broke the fast for a reason such as sickness, travel, menstruation and the like
title_ar: باب قَضَاءِ رَمَضَانَ فِي شَعْبَانَ ‏

title: Making up fasts on behalf of the deceased
title_ar: باب قَضَاءِ الصِّيَامِ عَنِ الْمَيِّتِ

title: If a fasting person is invited to eat and he does not want to break his fast, or someone insults him or argues with him, it is recommended for him to say: "I am Fasting", and he should protect his fast from obscene speech, ignorance and the like
title_ar: باب الصَّائِمِ يُدْعَى لِطَعَامٍ أَوْ يُقَاتَلُ فَلْيَقُلْ إِنِّي صَائِمٌ ‏

title: Guarding One's Tongue when Fasting
title_ar: باب حِفْظِ اللِّسَانِ لِلصَّائِمِ ‏

title: The Virtue of Fasting
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصِّيَامِ ‏

title: The Virtue of Fasting for in the cause of Allah, for those who are able to without suffering any harm or neglecting other duties
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصِّيَامِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لِمَنْ يُطِيقُهُ بِلاَ ضَرَرٍ وَلاَ تَفْوِيتِ حَقٍّ ‏

title: It is permissible to observe a voluntary fast with an intention formed during the day before the sun reaches its Zenith, and it is permissible for one who is observing a voluntary fast to break his fast with no excuse, although it is better for him to complete it
title_ar: بَاب جَوَازِ صَوْمِ النَّافِلَةِ بِنِيَّةٍ مِنْ النَّهَارِ قَبْلَ الزَّوَالِ وَجَوَازِ فِطْرِ الصَّائِمِ نَفْلًا مِنْ غَيْرِ عُذْرٍ

title: The one who eats, drinks, or has intercourse by mistake does not break his fast
title_ar: باب أَكْلُ النَّاسِي وَشُرْبُهُ وَجِمَاعُهُ لاَ يُفْطِرُ ‏

title: The Prophet's Fasts at times other than Ramadan; and it is recommended to ensure that no month is free of fasting
title_ar: بَاب صِيَامِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ فِي غَيْرِ رَمَضَانَ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ أَنْ لَا يُخْلِيَ شَهْرًا عَنْ صَوْمٍ

title: Prohibition of Fasting for a lifetime for the one who will be harmed by that or who will neglect other duties, or does not break his fast on the two 'Ids or during the days of At-Tashriq; It is better to fast alternate days
title_ar: بَاب النَّهْيِ عَنْ صَوْمِ الدَّهْرِ لِمَنْ تَضَرَّرَ بِهِ أَوْ فَوَّتَ بِهِ حَقًّا أَوْ لَمْ يُفْطِرْ الْعِيدَيْنِ وَالتَّشْرِيقَ وَبَيَانِ تَفْضِيلِ صَوْمِ يَوْمٍ وَإِفْطَارِ يَوْمٍ

title: It is recommended to fast three days of every month, and to fast on the days of 'Arafah and 'Ashura', and to fast on Mondays and Thursdays
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ صِيَامِ ثَلَاثَةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ كُلِّ شَهْرٍ وَصَوْمِ يَوْمِ عَرَفَةَ وَعَاشُورَاءَ وَالِاثْنَيْنِ وَالْخَمِيسِ

title: Fasting at the end of Sha'ban
title_ar: باب صَوْمِ سَرَرِ شَعْبَانَ ‏

title: The virtue of fasting Muharram
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ صَوْمِ الْمُحَرَّمِ ‏

title: It is recommended to fast Six Days in Shawwal following Ramadan
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ صَوْمِ سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ شَوَّالٍ اتِّبَاعًا لِرَمَضَانَ ‏

title: The virtue of Lailat Al-Qadr and the Exhortation to seek it; When it is and the most likely times to seek it
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ وَالْحَثِّ عَلَى طَلَبِهَا وَبَيَانِ مَحَلِّهَا وَأَرْجَى أَوْقَاتِ طَلَبِهَا

title: I'tikaf during the last ten days of Ramadan
title_ar: باب اعْتِكَافِ الْعَشْرِ الأَوَاخِرِ مِنْ رَمَضَانَ ‏

title: When should the one who wants to observe I'tikaf enter his place of I'tikaf?
title_ar: باب مَتَى يَدْخُلُ مَنْ أَرَادَ الاِعْتِكَافَ فِي مُعْتَكَفِهِ ‏

title: Striving harder in worship during the last ten days of Ramadan
title_ar: باب الاِجْتِهَادِ فِي الْعَشْرِ الأَوَاخِرِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ ‏

title: Fasting the (first) ten days of Dhul Hijjah
title_ar: باب صَوْمِ عَشْرِ ذِي الْحِجَّةِ ‏

title: What one who has entered Ihram for Hajj or Umrah is permitted to wear, and what is not permissible, and perfume is forbidden for him
title_ar: باب مَا يُبَاحُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ بِحَجٍّ أَوْ عُمْرَةٍ وَمَا لاَ يُبَاحُ وَبَيَانِ تَحْرِيمِ الطِّيبِ عَلَيْهِ

title: The Mawaqit of Hajj
title_ar: باب مَوَاقِيتِ الْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ‏

title: The Talbiyah, its description and timing
title_ar: باب التَّلْبِيَةِ وَصِفَتِهَا وَوَقْتِهَا ‏

title: The command to the people of Al-Madinah to enter Ihram from the Masjid at Dhul-Hulaifah
title_ar: باب أَمْرِ أَهْلِ الْمَدِينَةِ بِالإِحْرَامِ مِنْ عِنْدِ مَسْجِدِ ذِي الْحُلَيْفَةِ ‏

title: Clarifying that it is better to enter Ihram when a person's mount sets off with him, heading towards Makkah, not straight after the two rak'ah
title_ar: باب الإِهْلاَلِ مِنْ حَيْثُ تَنْبَعِثُ الرَّاحِلَةُ ‏

title: Praying at the Masjid of Dhul-Hulaifah
title_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ ذِي الْحُلَيْفَةِ ‏

title: It is recommended to apply perfume just before entering Ihram, and it is recommended to use Musk, and it does not matter if its glistening traces remain
title_ar: باب الطِّيبِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ عِنْدَ الإِحْرَامِ ‏

title: The prohibition of hunting game for the one who has entered Ihram for Hajj or for Umrah or for both
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الصَّيْدِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ

title: What animals it is recommended for the Muhrim and others to kill inside and outside the Sanctuary
title_ar: باب مَا يُنْدَبُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ وَغَيْرِهِ قَتْلُهُ مِنَ الدَّوَابِّ فِي الْحِلِّ وَالْحَرَمِ ‏

title: It is permissible for a Muhrim to shave his head if there is a problem, but it is obligatory to offer a Fidyah for shaving it, and Clarifying what the Fidyah is
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ حَلْقِ الرَّأْسِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ إِذَا كَانَ بِهِ أَذًى وَوُجُوبِ الْفِدْيَةِ لِحَلْقِهِ وَبَيَانِ قَدْرِهَا

title: Cupping is permissible for the Muhrim (pilgrim in Ihram)
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْحِجَامَةِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ ‏

title: It is permissible for a Muhrim to treat his eyes
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ مُدَاوَاةِ الْمُحْرِمِ عَيْنَيْهِ ‏

title: It is permissible for the Muhrim to wash his body and head
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ غَسْلِ الْمُحْرِمِ بَدَنَهُ وَرَأْسَهُ ‏

title: What should be done with a Muhrim if he dies?
title_ar: باب مَا يُفْعَلُ بِالْمُحْرِمِ إِذَا مَاتَ ‏

title: It is permissible for the Muhrim to stipulate a condition for exiting Ihram because of sickness and the like
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ اشْتِرَاطِ الْمُحْرِمِ التَّحَلُّلَ بِعُذْرِ الْمَرَضِ وَنَحْوِهِ ‏

title: The soundness of Ihram for the woman in Nifas; It is recommended for her to perform Ghusl before entering Ihram, and the same applies to one who is menstruating
title_ar: باب إِحْرَامِ النُّفَسَاءِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ اغْتِسَالِهَا لِلإِحْرَامِ وَكَذَا الْحَائِضِ ‏

title: Clarifying the types of Ihram; and that it is permissible to perfom Hajj that is Ifrad, Tamattu and Qiran. It is permissible to join Hajj to Umrah. And when the pilgrim who is performing Qiran should exit Ihram
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ وُجُوهِ الإِحْرَامِ وَأَنَّهُ يَجُوزُ إِفْرَادُ الْحَجِّ وَالتَّمَتُّعِ وَالْقِرَانِ وَجَوَازِ إِدْخَالِ الْحَجِّ عَلَى الْعُمْرَةِ وَمَتَى يَحِلُّ الْقَارِنُ مِنْ نُسُكِهِ

title: Tamattu with Hajj and Umrah
title_ar: باب فِي الْمُتْعَةِ بِالْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ‏

title: The Hajj of the Prophet (ﷺ) ﷺ
title_ar: باب حَجَّةِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏

title: All of Arafat is a place of standing
title_ar: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ عَرَفَةَ كُلَّهَا مَوْقِفٌ ‏

title: The Standing and the Saying of Allah, The Most High: "Then depart from the place whence all the people depart"
title_ar: باب فِي الْوُقُوفِ وَقَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى ‏{‏ ثُمَّ أَفِيضُوا مِنْ حَيْث أَفَاضَ النَّاسُ}

title: It is permissible to base one's intention for Ihram on the intention of another
title_ar: باب فِي نَسْخِ التَّحَلُّلِ مِنَ الإِحْرَامِ وَالأَمْرِ بِالتَّمَامِ ‏

title: The Permissibilty of Tamattu'
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ التَّمَتُّعِ

title: The Obligation For the Pilgrim who is performing Tamattu' to offer a sacrifice; If he has no animal to sacrifice, he must fast for three days during Hajj and seven days when he goes back to his family
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الدَّمِ عَلَى الْمُتَمَتِّعِ وَأَنَّهُ إِذَا عَدِمَهُ لَزِمَهُ صَوْمُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فِي الْحَجِّ وَسَبْعَةٍ إِذَا رَجَعَ إِلَى أَهْلِهِ

title: The pilgrim performing Qiran should not exit Ihram except when the pilgrims performing Ifrad exit Ihram
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْقَارِنَ لاَ يَتَحَلَّلُ إِلاَّ فِي وَقْتِ تَحَلُّلِ الْحَاجِّ الْمُفْرِدِ ‏

title: It is permissible to exit Ihram if one is prevented from completing Hajj; It is permissible to perform Qiran and the pilgrim performing Qiran should perform just one Tawaf and one Sa'i
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ جَوَازِ التَّحَلُّلِ بِالإِحْصَارِ وَجَوَازِ الْقِرَانِ ‏

title: Ifrad and Qiran
title_ar: باب فِي الإِفْرَادِ وَالْقِرَانِ بِالْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ‏

title: It is recommended for the pilgrim to perform Tawaf Al-Qudum and As-Sa'i after it
title_ar: باب مَا يَلْزَمُ مَنْ أَحْرَمَ بِالْحَجِّ ثُمَّ قَدِمَ مَكَّةَ مِنَ الطَّوَافِ وَالسَّعْىِ ‏

title: Clarifying that the pilgrim who has entered Ihram for Umrah should not exit Ihram after performing Tawaf before Sa'i; And the pilgrim who has entered Ihram for Hajj should not exit Ihram after performing Tawaf Al-Qudum, and the same applies to the pilgrim performing Qiran
title_ar: باب مَا يَلْزَمُ مَنْ طَافَ بِالْبَيْتِ وَسَعَى مِنَ الْبَقَاءِ عَلَى الإِحْرَامِ وَتَرْكِ التَّحَلُّلِ ‏

title: Tamattu' in Hajj
title_ar: باب فِي مُتْعَةِ الْحَجِّ ‏

title: It is permissible to perform 'Umrah during the months of Hajj
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْعُمْرَةِ فِي أَشْهُرِ الْحَجِّ ‏

title: Marking and Garlanding the sacrificial animal when entering Ihram
title_ar: باب تَقْلِيدِ الْهَدْىِ وَإِشْعَارِهِ عِنْدَ الإِحْرَامِ ‏

title: It is permissible for the pilgrim performing Umrah to shorten his hair and he does not have to shave it. It is recommended for him to shave his hair or shorten it at Al-Marwah
title_ar: باب التَّقْصِيرِ فِي الْعُمْرَةِ ‏

title: The Ihram and Hadi of the Prophet (ﷺ)
title_ar: باب إِهْلاَلِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَهَدْيِهِ ‏

title: The number of Umrahs performed by the prophet (ﷺ) and when he performed them
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ عَدَدِ عُمَرِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَزَمَانِهِنَّ ‏

title: The virtue of the Umrah performed during Ramadan
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْعُمْرَةِ فِي رَمَضَانَ ‏

title: It is recommended to enter Makkah from the Upper Mountain Pass and to leave from the Lower Mountain Pass; Entering a city via a route different than the one by which you leave it
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ دُخُولِ مَكَّةَ مِنَ الثَّنِيَّةِ الْعُلْيَا وَالْخُرُوجِ مِنْهَا مِنَ الثَّنِيَّةِ السُّفْلَى وَدُخُولِ بَلْدَةٍ مِنْ طَرِيقٍ غَيْرِ الَّتِي خَرَجَ مِنْهَا

title: It is recommended to stay overnight in Dhu Tuwa when intending to enter Makkah, and to perform Ghusl before entering it, and to enter it by day
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْمَبِيتِ بِذِي طَوًى عِنْدَ إِرَادَةِ دُخُولِ مَكَّةَ وَالاِغْتِسَالِ لِدُخُولِهَا نَهَارًا

title: Raml (walking rapidly) is recommended in the Tawaf of Umrah, and in the first Tawaf of Hajj
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الرَّمَلِ فِي الطَّوَافِ وَالْعُمْرَةِ وَفِي الطَّوَافِ الأَوَّلِ فِي الْحَجِّ ‏

title: It is recommended to touch the two Yemeni Corners in Tawaf and not the other two corners
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ اسْتِلاَمِ الرُّكْنَيْنِ الْيَمَانِيَيْنِ فِي الطَّوَافِ دُونَ الرُّكْنَيْنِ الآخَرَيْن

title: It is recommended to kiss the black stone during circumambulation (Tawaf)
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَقْبِيلِ الْحَجَرِ الأَسْوَدِ فِي الطَّوَافِ ‏

title: It is permissible to circumambulate the Ka'bah on a camel and the like, And for one who is riding to touch the (black) stone with a crooked staff and the like.
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الطَّوَافِ عَلَى بَعِيرٍ وَغَيْرِهِ وَاسْتِلاَمِ الْحَجَرِ بِمِحْجَنٍ وَنَحْوِهِ لِلرَّاكِبِ

title: Clarifying that Sa'i between As-safa and Al-Marwah is a pillar of Hajj, without which Hajj is not valid
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ السَّعْىَ بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةِ رُكْنٌ لاَ يَصِحُّ الْحَجُّ إِلاَّ بِهِ ‏

title: Clarifying that Sa'i should not be repeated
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ السَّعْىَ لاَ يُكَرَّرُ ‏

title: It is recommended for the pilgrim to continue reciting the Talbiyah until he starts stoning Jamrat Al-'Aqabah on the day of sacrifice
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ إِدَامَةِ الْحَاجِّ التَّلْبِيَةَ حَتَّى يَشْرَعَ فِي رَمْىِ جَمْرَةِ الْعَقَبَةِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ

title: The Talbiyah and the Takbir when going from Mina to 'Arafat on the day of 'Arafat
title_ar: باب التَّلْبِيَةِ وَالتَّكْبِيرِ فِي الذِّهَابِ مِنْ مِنًى إِلَى عَرَفَاتٍ فِي يَوْمِ عَرَفَةَ ‏

title: Departing from 'Arafat to Al-Muzdalifah. It is recommended to pray Maghrib and 'Isha together in Al-Muzdalifah on this night
title_ar: باب الإِفَاضَةِ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ إِلَى الْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ صَلاَتَىِ الْمَغْرِبِ وَالْعِشَاءِ جَمْعًا بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ

title: It is recommended to pray Subh when it is still dark on the day of sacrifice in Al-Muzdalifah, and to do it very early after ascertaining that dawn has broken
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ زِيَادَةِ التَّغْلِيسِ بِصَلاَةِ الصُّبْحِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَالْمُبَالَغَةِ فِيهِ بَعْدَ تَحَقُّقِ طُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ

title: It is recommended to send the weak among women and others ahead from Al-Muzdalifah to Mina at the end of the night, before it gets crowded, but it is recommended for others to stay there until they have prayed Subh in Al-Muzdalifah
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَقْدِيمِ دَفْعِ الضَّعَفَةِ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ وَغَيْرِهِنَّ مِنْ مُزْدَلِفَةَ إِلَى مِنًى فِي أَوَاخِرِ اللَّيَالِي قَبْلَ زَحْمَةِ النَّاسِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ الْمُكْثِ لِغَيْرِهِمْ حَتَّى يُصَلُّوا الصُّبْحَ بِمُزْدَلِفَةَ

title: Stoning Jamrat Al-'Aqabah from the bottom of the valley; Makkah should be on to one's left and one should say Takbir with each throw
title_ar: باب رَمْىِ جَمْرَةِ الْعَقَبَةِ مِنْ بَطْنِ الْوَادِي وَتَكُونُ مَكَّةُ عَنْ يَسَارِهِ وَيُكَبِّرُ مَعَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ

title: It is recommended to stone Jamrat Al-'Aqabah, on the day of sacrifice, riding, and the prophet ﷺ said: "Learn your rituals (of Hajj) from me"
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ رَمْىِ جَمْرَةِ الْعَقَبَةِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ رَاكِبًا وَبَيَانِ قَوْلِهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ تَعَالَى عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: «لِتَأْخُذُوا مَنَاسِكَكُمْ»

title: It is recommended for the pebbles used for stoning to be the size of broad beans
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ كَوْنِ حَصَى الْجِمَارِ بِقَدْرِ حَصَى الْخَذْفِ ‏

title: The time when it is recommended to stone the Jamrah
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ وَقْتِ اسْتِحْبَابِ الرَّمْىِ ‏

title: The number of pebbles for stoning the Jamrahs is seven at a time
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ حَصَى الْجِمَارِ سَبْعٌ ‏

title: Shaving the head is preferrable to cutting the hair, although cutting the hair is permissible
title_ar: باب تَفْضِيلِ الْحَلْقِ عَلَى التَّقْصِيرِ وَجَوَازِ التَّقْصِيرِ ‏‏

title: The Sunnah on the day of sacrifice is to stone the Jamrah, then offer the sacrifice, then shave the head, and shaving should be started on the right side of the head
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ السُّنَّةَ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ أَنْ يَرْمِيَ ثُمَّ يَنْحَرَ ثُمَّ يَحْلِقَ وَالاِبْتِدَاءِ فِي الْحَلْقِ بِالْجَانِبِ الأَيْمَنِ مِنْ رَأْسِ الْمَحْلُوقِ

title: It is permissible to offer the sacrifice before stoning the Jamrah, or to shave before offering the sacrifice or stoning the Jamrah, or to perform Tawaf before any of them
title_ar: باب مَنْ حَلَقَ قَبْلَ النَّحْرِ أَوْ نَحَرَ قَبْلَ الرَّمْىِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to perform Tawaf Al-Ifadah on the day of sacrifice
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ طَوَافِ الإِفَاضَةِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to halt at Al-Muhassab on the day of departing from Mina and to perform Zuhr and subsequent prayers there
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ النُّزُولِ بِالْمُحَصَّبِ يَوْمَ النَّفْرِ وَالصَّلاَةِ بِهِ ‏‏

title: It is obligatory to stay overnight in Mina during the nights of the days of At-Tashriq, and the concession allowing those who supply water to leave
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الْمَبِيتِ بِمِنًى لَيَالِيَ أَيَّامِ التَّشْرِيقِ وَالتَّرْخِيصِ فِي تَرْكِهِ لأَهْلِ السِّقَايَةِ

title: Giving the meat, skin and blankets of the Hadi in charity; the butcher should not be given any of it; It is permissible to delegate someone else to offer the sacrifice
title_ar: باب فِي الصَّدَقَةِ بِلُحُومِ الْهَدْىِ وَجُلُودِهَا وَجِلاَلِهَا ‏‏

title: It is permissible to share in the sacrifice, and a camel or a cow is sufficient for seven people
title_ar: باب الاِشْتِرَاكِ فِي الْهَدْىِ وَإِجْزَاءِ الْبَقَرَةِ وَالْبَدَنَةِ كُلٍّ مِنْهُمَا عَنْ سَبْعَةٍ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to sacrifice the camel when it is standing and tied
title_ar: باب نَحْرِ الْبُدْنِ قِيَامًا مُقَيَّدَةً ‏‏

title: It is recommended to send the sacrificial animal to the Haram for one who does not intend to go there himself; It is reommended to garland it and to make the garland, but the one who sends it does not enter a state of Ihram, and nothing is forbidden to him because of that
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ بَعْثِ الْهَدْىِ إِلَى الْحَرَمِ لِمَنْ لاَ يُرِيدُ الذَّهَابَ بِنَفْسِهِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ تَقْلِيدِهِ وَفَتْلِ الْقَلاَئِدِ وَأَنَّ بَاعِثَهُ لاَ يَصِيرُ مُحْرِمًا وَلاَ يَحْرُمُ عَلَيْهِ شيء بِذَلِكَ

title: It is permissible to ride the sacrificial animal if necessary
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ رُكُوبِ الْبَدَنَةِ الْمُهْدَاةِ لِمَنِ احْتَاجَ إِلَيْهَا ‏‏

title: What should be done with the sacrificial animal if it gets injured on the way?
title_ar: باب مَا يُفْعَلُ بِالْهَدْىِ إِذَا عَطِبَ فِي الطَّرِيقِ ‏‏

title: The farewell Tawaf is obligatory, but it is waived in the case of menstruating women
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ طَوَافِ الْوَدَاعِ وَسُقُوطِهِ عَنِ الْحَائِضِ

title: It is recommended for pilgrims and others to enter the Ka'bah and pray therein, and supplicate in all its corners
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ دُخُولِ الْكَعْبَةِ لِلْحَاجِّ وَغَيْرِهِ وَالصَّلاَةِ فِيهَا وَالدُّعَاءِ فِي نَوَاحِيهَا كُلِّهَا

title: Demolishing the Ka'bah and rebuilding it
title_ar: باب نَقْضِ الْكَعْبَةِ وَبِنَائِهَا ‏‏

title: The wall and the door of the Ka'bah
title_ar: باب جَدْرِ الْكَعْبَةِ وَبَابِهَا ‏‏

title: Hajj on behalf of one who is incapable of doing it because of chronic illness, old age and the like, or on behalf of one who has died
title_ar: باب الْحَجِّ عَنِ الْعَاجِزِ، لِزَمَانَةٍ وَهِرَمٍ وَنَحْوِهِمَا أَوْ لِلْمَوْتِ ‏‏

title: Validity of a child's hajj, and the reward of the one who takes him for Hajj
title_ar: باب صِحَّةِ حَجِّ الصَّبِيِّ وَأَجْرِ مَنْ حَجَّ بِهِ ‏‏

title: Hajj is obligatory once in a lifetime
title_ar: باب فَرْضِ الْحَجِّ مَرَّةً فِي الْعُمْرِ ‏‏

title: A woman travelling with a Mahram for Hajj and other purposes
title_ar: باب سَفَرِ الْمَرْأَةِ مَعَ مَحْرَمٍ إِلَى حَجٍّ وَغَيْرِهِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to recite statements of remembrance when setting out for Hajj or any other purpose, and the best of this remembrances
title_ar: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا رَكِبَ إِلَى سَفَرٍ الْحَجِّ وَغَيْرِهِ ‏‏

title: What should be said when returning from Hajj and other journeys
title_ar: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا قَفَلَ مِنْ سَفَرٍ الْحَجِّ وَغَيْرِهِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to stop in Batha' of Dhul-Hulaifah and pray there when departing from Hajj and 'Umrah, or any time one passes through it
title_ar: باب التَّعْرِيسِ بِذِي الْحُلَيْفَةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ بِهَا إِذَا صَدَرَ مِنَ الْحَجِّ أَوِ الْعُمْرَةِ ‏‏

title: No idolator may circumambulate the house, and no one may circumambulate the house naked, and when the greatest day of Hajj is
title_ar: باب لاَ يَحُجُّ الْبَيْتَ مُشْرِكٌ وَلاَ يَطُوفُ بِالْبَيْتِ عُرْيَانٌ وَبَيَانُ يَوْمِ الْحَجِّ الأَكْبَبَرِ

title: The virtue of the day of 'Arafat
title_ar: باب فِي فَضْلِ الْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ وَيَوْمِ عَرَفَةَ ‏‏

title: Pilgrims staying in Makkah, and Inheriting its houses
title_ar: باب النُّزُولِ بِمَكَّةَ لِلْحَاجِّ وَتَوْرِيثِ دُورِهَا ‏‏

title: It is permissible for the one who emigrated from Makkah to stay there for three days after completing Hajj and 'Umrah, and no more than that
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الإِقَامَةِ بِمَكَّةَ لِلْمُهَاجِرِ مِنْهَا بَعْدَ فَرَاغِ الْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ بِلاَ زِيَادَةٍ

title: The sanctity of Makkah and the sanctity of its game, grasses, trees and lost property, except for the one who announces it, is forever
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ مَكَّةَ وَصَيْدِهَا وَخَلاَهَا وَشَجَرِهَا وَلُقَطَتِهَا إِلاَّ لِمُنْشِدٍ عَلَى الدَّوَام

title: The prohibition of carrying weapons in Makkah when there is no need for that
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ حَمْلِ السِّلاَحِ، بِمَكَّةَ بِلاَ حَاجَةٍ ‏‏

title: It is permissible to enter Makkah without Ihram
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ دُخُولِ مَكَّةَ بِغَيْرِ إِحْرَامٍ ‏‏

title: The virtue of Al-Madinah and the Prophet's Prayer for it to be blessed. Its sanctity and the sanctity of its game and trees. The Boundaries of its sanctuary
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْمَدِينَةِ وَدُعَاءِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فِيهَا بِالْبَرَكَةِ وَبَيَانِ تَحْرِيمِها وَتَحْرِيمِ صَيْدِهَا وَشَجَرِهَا وَبَيَانِ حُدُودِ حَرَمِهَا

title: Encouragement to live in Al-Madinah and to be patient on bearing its distress and hardships
title_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي سُكْنَى الْمَدِينَةِ وَالصَّبْرِ عَلَى لأْوَائِهَا ‏‏

title: Al-Madinah is protected against the plague and the Dajjal entering it
title_ar: باب صِيَانَةِ الْمَدِينَةِ مِنْ دُخُولِ الطَّاعُونِ وَالدَّجَّالِ إِلَيْهَا ‏‏

title: Al-Madinah eliminates its Dross and it is also called Tabah, and Taibah
title_ar: باب الْمَدِينَةِ تَنْفِي شِرَارَهَا ‏‏

title: The prohibition of wishing ill towards the people of Al-Madinah, and that the one who wishes them ill will be caused to melt by Allah
title_ar: باب مَنْ أَرَادَ أَهْلَ الْمَدِينَةِ بِسُوءٍ أَذَابَهُ اللَّهُ ‏‏

title: Encouraging people to stay in Al-Madinah when the regions were conquered
title_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ عِنْدَ فَتْحِ الأَمْصَارِ ‏‏

title: The Prophet (ﷺ) ﷺ foretold that the people will abandon Al-Madinah when it is the best it ever was
title_ar: باب فِي الْمَدِينَةِ حِينَ يَتْرُكُهَا أَهْلُهَا ‏‏

title: The virtue of the area between the prophet's grave and his Minbar, and the virtue of the spot where his minbar is
title_ar: باب مَا بَيْنَ الْقَبْرِ وَالْمِنْبَرِ رَوْضَةٌ مِنْ رِيَاضِ الْجَنَّةِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of Uhud
title_ar: باب أُحُدٌ جَبَلٌ يُحِبُّنَا وَنُحِبُّهُ ‏‏

title: The virtue of praying in the Masajid of Makkah and Al-Madinah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ بِمَسْجِدَىْ مَكَّةَ وَالْمَدِينَةِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of the Three Masajid
title_ar: باب لاَ تُشَدُّ الرِّحَالُ إِلاَّ إِلَى ثَلاَثَةِ مَسَاجِدَ ‏‏

title: The Masjid whose foundation was founded upon piety is the Masjid of the Prophet (ﷺ) ﷺ in Al-Madinah
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْمَسْجِدَ الَّذِي أُسِّسَ عَلَى التَّقْوَى هُوَ مَسْجِدُ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِالْمَدِينَةِ

title: The virtue of the Masjid of Quba', and the virtue of praying therein and visiting it
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ مَسْجِدِ قُبَاءٍ وَفَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ فِيهِ وَزِيَارَتِهِ ‏‏

title: Marriage is recommended for the one who desires it and can afford it, and the one who cannot afford it should distract himself by fasting
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ النِّكَاحِ لِمَنْ تَاقَتْ نَفْسُهُ إِلَيْهِ وَوَجَدَ مُؤْنَةً وَاشْتِغَالِ مَنْ عَجَزَ عَنِ الْمُؤَنِ بِالصَّوْمِ

title: Recommendation to the one who sees a woman and is attracted to her, to go to his wife or slave woman and have intercourse with her
title_ar: باب نَدْبِ مَنْ رَأَى امْرَأَةً فَوَقَعَتْ فِي نَفْسِهِ إِلَى أَنْ يَأْتِيَ امْرَأَتَهُ أَوْ جَارِيَتَهُ فَيُوَاقِعَهَا

title: Mut'ah Marriage: It was permitted then abrograted, then permitted then abrogated, and it will remain Forbidden until the day of resurrection
title_ar: باب نِكَاحِ الْمُتْعَةِ وَبَيَانِ أَنَّهُ أُبِيحَ ثُمَّ نُسِخَ ثُمَّ أُبِيحَ ثُمَّ نُسِخَ وَاسْتَقَرَّ تَحْرِيمُهُ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ

title: The prohibition of being married to a woman and her paternal aunt or maternal aunt at the same time
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْجَمْعِ بَيْنَ الْمَرْأَةِ وَعَمَّتِهَا أَوْ خَالَتِهَا فِي النِّكَاحِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of marriage for one who is in Ihram, and it is disliked for him to propose marriage
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ نِكَاحِ الْمُحْرِمِ وَكَرَاهَةِ خِطْبَتِهِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of proposing marriage when one's brother has already proposed, unless he gives permission or gives up the idea
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْخِطْبَةِ عَلَى خِطْبَةِ أَخِيهِ حَتَّى يَأْذَنَ أَوْ يَتْرُكَ ‏‏

title: Prohibition and invalidity of Shighar Marriage
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ نِكَاحِ الشِّغَارِ وَبُطْلاَنِهِ ‏‏

title: Fulfilling the conditions stipulated in the Marriage
title_ar: باب الْوَفَاءِ بِالشُّرُوطِ فِي النِّكَاحِ ‏‏

title: Seeking permission of a previously-married woman in words, and of a virgin by silence
title_ar: باب اسْتِئْذَانِ الثَّيِّبِ فِي النِّكَاحِ بِالنُّطْقِ وَالْبِكْرِ بِالسُّكُوتِ ‏

title: It is permissible for a father to arrange the marriage of a young virgin
title_ar: باب تَزْوِيجِ الأَبِ الْبِكْرَ الصَّغِيرَةَ ‏

title: It is recommended to get married and arrange marriages in Shawwal, and it is recommended to consummate the marriage in that month
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ التَّزَوُّجِ وَالتَّزْوِيجِ فِي شَوَّالٍ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ الدُّخُولِ فِيهِ ‏

title: It is recommended for the one who wants to marry a woman to look at her face and hands before proposing marriage to her
title_ar: باب نَدْبِ النَّظَرِ إِلَى وَجْهِ الْمَرْأَةِ وَكَفَّيْهَا لِمَنْ يُرِيدُ تَزَوُّجَهَا ‏

title: The Dowry. It is permissible for the dowry to be teaching Quran, a ring of iron or anything else, a small or large amount, And it is recommended for it to be Five Hundred Dirham
title_ar: باب الصَّدَاقِ وَجَوَازِ كَوْنِهِ تَعْلِيمَ قُرْآنٍ وَخَاتَمَ حَدِيدٍ وَغَيْرَ ذَلِكَ مِنْ قَلِيلٍ وَكَثِيرٍ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ كَوْنِهِ خَمْسَمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ لِمَنْ لاَ يُجْحَفُ بِهِ

title: The virute of manumitting one's slave girl, then marrying her
title_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ إِعْتَاقِهِ أَمَتَهُ ثُمَّ يَتَزَوَّجُهَا ‏

title: The Marriage of Zainab Bint Jahsh, The Revelation of (the verse of) Hijab, and confirmation of the importance of the wedding feast.
title_ar: باب زَوَاجِ زَيْنَبَ بِنْتِ جَحْشٍ وَنُزُولِ الْحِجَابِ وَإِثْبَاتِ وَلِيمَةِ الْعُرْسِ ‏

title: The command to accept invitations
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِإِجَابَةِ الدَّاعِي إِلَى دَعْوَةٍ ‏

title: It is not permissible for a woman who has been thrice-divorced to return to the one who divorced her until she marries another husband who has intercourse with her, then divorces her, and she completes the 'Iddah
title_ar: باب لاَ تَحِلُّ الْمُطَلَّقَةُ ثَلاَثًا لِمُطَلِّقِهَا حَتَّى تَنْكِحَ زَوْجًا غَيْرَهُ وَيَطَأَهَا ثُمَّ يُفَارِقَهَا وَتَنْقَضِي عِدَّتُهَا

title: What it is recommended to say when having intercourse
title_ar: باب مَا يُسْتَحَبُّ أَنْ يَقُولَهُ عِنْدَ الْجِمَاعِ ‏

title: It is permissible for a man to have intercourse with his wife from the front or from the back, without entering the behind
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ جِمَاعِهِ امْرَأَتَهُ فِي قُبُلِهَا مِنْ قُدَّامِهَا وَمِنْ وَرَائِهَا مِنْ غَيْرِ تَعَرُّضٍ لِلدُّبُرِ

title: It is unlawful for the wife to refuse to come to her husband's bed
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ امْتِنَاعِهَا مِنْ فِرَاشِ زَوْجِهَا ‏

title: The prohibition of disclosing a woman's secrets
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ إِفْشَاءِ سِرِّ الْمَرْأَةِ ‏

title: The ruling on coitus interrupts ('Azl)
title_ar: باب حُكْمِ الْعَزْلِ ‏

title: The prohibition of intercourse with a pregnant captive woman
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ وَطْءِ الْحَامِلِ الْمَسْبِيَّةِ ‏

title: It is permissible to have intercourse with a breastfeeding woman (Ghilah), and 'Azl is disliked
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْغِيلَةِ وَهِيَ وَطْءُ الْمُرْضِعِ وَكَرَاهَةِ الْعَزْلِ

title: "Breastfeeding Makes Unlawful What Birth Makes Unlawful."
title_ar: باب يَحْرُمُ مِنَ الرَّضَاعَةِ مَا يَحْرُمُ مِنَ الْوِلاَدَةِ ‏

title: The prohibition that results from breastfeeding is related to the issue of the male
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الرَّضَاعَةِ مِنْ مَاءِ الْفَحْلِ ‏

title: The daughter of one's brother through breastfeeding is forbidden in marriage
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ ابْنَةِ الأَخِ مِنَ الرَّضَاعَةِ ‏

title: The prohibition of marriage to one's stepdaughter and the sister of one's wife
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الرَّبِيبَةِ وَأُخْتِ الْمَرْأَةِ ‏

title: One or Two sucks
title_ar: باب فِي الْمَصَّةِ وَالْمَصَّتَيْنِ ‏

title: Becoming Mahram is established by Five Breastfeedings
title_ar: باب التَّحْرِيمِ بِخَمْسِ رَضَعَاتٍ ‏

title: Breastfeeding an adult
intro: المقصود بالرضاعة هنا أن تفرغ المرأة لبنها في إناء وترسله للرجل ليشربه وتكرر ذلك خمس مرات وبذلك تحرم عليه.
title_ar: باب رَضَاعَةِ الْكَبِيرِ ‏

title: Breastfeeding is because of Hunger (meaning, during infancy)
title_ar: باب إِنَّمَا الرَّضَاعَةُ مِنَ الْمَجَاعَةِ

title: It is permissible to have intercourse with a female captive after it is established that she is not pregnant, and if she has a husband, then her marriage is annulled when she is captured
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ وَطْءِ الْمَسْبِيَّةِ بَعْدَ الاِسْتِبْرَاءِ وَإِنْ كَانَ لَهَا زَوْجٌ انْفَسَخَ نِكَاحُهَا بِالسَّبْي

title: The child is for the bed and suspicion must be avoided
title_ar: باب الْوَلَدِ لِلْفِرَاشِ وَتَوَقِّي الشُّبُهَاتِ ‏‏

title: Detecting relationships from physical features
title_ar: باب الْعَمَلِ بِإِلْحَاقِ الْقَائِفِ الْوَلَدَ ‏‏

title: How long a virgin and a previously-married woman are entitled to have the husband stay with them after marriage
title_ar: باب قَدْرِ مَا تَسْتَحِقُّهُ الْبِكْرُ وَالثَّيِّبُ مِنْ إِقَامَةِ الزَّوْجِ عِنْدَهَا عَقِبَ الزِّفَافِ

title: Dividing one's time among co-wives; The Sunnah is for each one to have one night and one day
title_ar: باب الْقَسْمِ بَيْنَ الزَّوْجَاتِ وَبَيَانِ أَنَّ السُّنَّةَ أَنْ تَكُونَ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدَةٍ لَيْلَةٌ مَعَ يَوْمِهَا

title: It is permissible for a wife to give her turn to a co-wife
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ هِبَتِهَا نَوْبَتَهَا لِضَرَّتِهَا ‏‏

title: It is recommended to marry one who is religiously committed
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ نِكَاحِ ذَاتِ الدِّينِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to marry virgins
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ نِكَاحِ الْبِكْرِ

title: The best temporary joy of this world is a righteous woman
title_ar: باب خَيْرُ مَتَاعِ الدُّنْيَا الْمَرْأَةُ الصَّالِحَةُ ‏‏

title: Advice with regard to women
title_ar: باب الْوَصِيَّةِ بِالنِّسَاءِ ‏‏

title: Were it not for Hawa', no female would ever betray her husband
title_ar: باب لَوْلاَ حَوَّاءُ لَمْ تَخُنْ أُنْثَى زَوْجَهَا الدَّهْرَ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of divorcing a menstruating woman without her consent; If a man breaks this rule, it still counts as a divorce, and he should be ordered to take her back
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ طَلاَقِ الْحَائِضِ بِغَيْرِ رِضَاهَا وَأَنَّهُ لَوْ خَالَفَ وَقَعَ الطَّلاَقُ وَيُؤْمَرُ بِجْعَتِهَا

title: Threefold Divorce
title_ar: باب طَلاَقِ الثَّلاَثِ ‏‏

title: Expiation must be offered by one who declares his wife to be unlawful for him but does not intend divorce thereby
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الْكَفَّارَةِ عَلَى مَنْ حَرَّمَ امْرَأَتَهُ وَلَمْ يَنْوِ الطَّلاَقَ ‏‏

title: Giving one's wife the choice does not count as a divorce, unless it is intended as such
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ تَخْيِيرَ امْرَأَتِهِ لاَ يَكُونُ طَلاَقًا إِلاَّ بِالنِّيَّةِ ‏‏

title: Ila', Keeping away from one's wives and giving them the choice, And the saying of Allah, The Most High: "But if you help one another against him
title_ar: باب فِي الإِيلاَءِ وَاعْتِزَالِ النِّسَاءِ وَتَخْيِيرِهِنَّ وَقَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى: {وَإِنْ تَظَاهَرَا عَلَيْهِ}

title: The woman who has been irrevocably divorced is not entitled to spending
title_ar: باب الْمُطَلَّقَةُ ثَلاَثًا لاَ نَفَقَةَ لَهَا ‏‏

title: It is permissible for a woman who is observing 'Iddah after an irrevocable divorce or the death of her husband to go out during the day if she needs to
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ خُرُوجِ الْمُعْتَدَّةِ الْبَائِنِ وَالْمُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا فِي النَّهَارِ لِحَاجَتِهَا

title: The 'Iddah of a woman whose husband had died, and the like, ends when she gives birth.
title_ar: باب انْقِضَاءِ عِدَّةِ الْمُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا وَغَيْرِهَا بِوَضْعِ الْحَمْلِ ‏‏

title: The Obligation to mourn during the 'Iddah following the death of one's husband, but it is forbidden to mourn for more than three days in other cases
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الإِحْدَادِ فِي عِدَّةِ الْوَفَاةِ وَتَحْرِيمِهِ فِي غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ إِلاَّ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ
باب ‏

title: One who frees his share of a slave
title_ar: باب مَنْ أَعْتَقَ شِرْكًا لَهُ فِي عَبْدٍ ‏‏

title: A slave working to pay off the other half
title_ar: باب ذِكْرِ سِعَايَةِ الْعَبْدِ ‏‏

title: Al-Wala' (Right of inheritance) belongs to the one who manumits the slave
title_ar: باب إِنَّمَا الْوَلاَءُ لِمَنْ أَعْتَقَ

title: The prohibition of selling or giving away the wala'
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ الْوَلاَءِ، وَهِبَتِهِ، ‏‏

title: The prohibition of a manumitted slave taking anyone as a Mawla except the one who manumitted him
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ تَوَلِّي الْعَتِيقِ غَيْرَ مَوَالِيهِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of manumitting slaves
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْعِتْقِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of manumitting one's father
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ عِتْقِ الْوَالِدِ ‏‏

title: The invalidity of Mulamasah and Munabadhah transactions
title_ar: باب إِبْطَالِ بَيْعِ الْمُلاَمَسَةِ وَالْمُنَابَذَةِ

title: The invalidity of Hasah transactions and transactions involving ambiguity
title_ar: باب بُطْلاَنِ بَيْعِ الْحَصَاةِ وَالْبَيْعِ الَّذِي فِيهِ غَرَرٌ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of selling Habl Al-Habalah
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ حَبَلِ الْحَبَلَةِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of urging a buyer to cancel a purchase in order to sell him one's own goods; And urging a seller to cancel a sale already agreed upon so that one can buy the goods oneself; And the prohibition of artificially inflating prices; And the prohibition of letting milk accumulate in the udder in order to deceive the purchaser
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الرَّجُلِ عَلَى بَيْعِ أَخِيهِ وَسَوْمِهِ عَلَى سَوْمِهِ وَتَحْرِيمِ النَّجْشِ وَتَحْرِيمِ التَّصْرِيَةِ

title: The prohibition of intercepting traders
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ تَلَقِّي الْجَلَبِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of the town-dweller selling on behalf of a bedouin
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الْحَاضِرِ لِلْبَادِي ‏‏

title: Ruling on selling Al-Musarrah (An animal in whose udder milk has been allowed to accumulate)
title_ar: باب حُكْمِ بَيْعِ الْمُصَرَّاةِ ‏‏

title: It is invalid to sell goods before taking possession of them
title_ar: باب بُطْلاَنِ بَيْعِ الْمَبِيعِ قَبْلَ الْقَبْضِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of selling a heap of dates the weight of which is unknown
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ صُبْرَةِ التَّمْرِ الْمَجْهُولَةِ الْقَدْرِ بِتَمْرٍ ‏‏

title: Affirming that both parties to a transaction have the option (of canceling it) while they are still together
title_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ خِيَارِ الْمَجْلِسِ لِلْمُتَبَايِعَيْنِ ‏‏

title: Honesty in selling and disclosure of defects
title_ar: باب الصِّدْقِ فِي الْبَيْعِ وَالْبَيَانِ ‏‏

title: One who is deceived in transactions
title_ar: باب مَنْ يُخْدَعُ فِي الْبَيْعِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of selling produce before its goodness appears
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ الثِّمَارِ، قَبْلَ بُدُوِّ صَلاَحِهَا بِغَيْرِ شَرْطِ الْقَطْعِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of selling fresh dates in exchange for dry dates except in the case of 'Araya
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الرُّطَبِ بِالتَّمْرِ إِلاَّ فِي الْعَرَايَا ‏‏

title: One who sells date palms on which there are dates
title_ar: باب مَنْ بَاعَ نَخْلاً عَلَيْهَا ثَمَرٌ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of Muhaqalah and Muzabanah and Mukhabarah: and selling produce before its goodness appears, and Mu'awamah: which is selling years in advance
title_ar: باب النَّهْيِ عَنِ الْمُحَاقَلَةِ وَالْمُزَابَنَةِ وَعَنِ الْمُخَابَرَةِ وَبَيْعِ الثَّمَرَةِ قَبْلَ بُدُوِّ صَلاَحِهَا وَعَنْ بَيْعِ الْمُعَاوَمَةِ وَهُوَ بَيْعُ السِّنِينَ

title: Kira (leasing Land)
title_ar: باب كِرَاءِ الأَرْضِ ‏‏

title: Leasing out Land (Kira) in return for food
title_ar: باب كِرَاءِ الأَرْضِ بِالطَّعَامِ ‏‏

title: Leasing out Land (Kira) for gold and silver
title_ar: باب كِرَاءِ الأَرْضِ بِالذَّهَبِ وَالْوَرِقِ ‏‏

title: Muzura'ah (Sharecropping) and Mu'ajarah
title_ar: باب فِي الْمُزَارَعَةِ وَالْمُؤَاجَرَةِ ‏‏

title: Lending Land
title_ar: باب الأَرْضِ تُمْنَحُ ‏‏

title: Musaqah And Mu'amalah in return for a share of the fruit and crops
title_ar: باب الْمُسَاقَاةِ وَالْمُعَامَلَةِ بِجُزْءٍ مِنَ الثَّمَرِ وَالزَّرْعِ

title: The Virtue of Planting and Cultivating
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْغَرْسِ وَالزَّرْعِ ‏‏

title: Waiving Payment in the case of Blight
title_ar: باب وَضْعِ الْجَوَائِحِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to waive debts
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْوَضْعِ مِنَ الدَّيْنِ

title: If a man finds what he sold with the purchaser, who has become bankrupt, then he has the right to take it back
title_ar: باب مَنْ أَدْرَكَ مَا بَاعَهُ عِنْدَ الْمُشْتَرِي وَقَدْ أَفْلَسَ فَلَهُ الرُّجُوعُ فِيهِ ‏‏

title: The virute of giving more time to one who is suffering difficulty, and letting those go who are suffering difficulty and those who are well off
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ إِنْظَارِ الْمُعْسِرِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of a rich man delaying repayment. The validity of Hawalah (Transferal of Debts) and it is recommended to accept transferal of a debt if it is transferred to a rich man
title_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ مَطْلِ الْغَنِيِّ وَصِحَّةِ الْحَوَالَةِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ قَبُولِهَا إِذَا أُحِيلَ عَلَى مَلِيٍّ

title: The prohibition of selling surplus water which is in the wilderness and is needed to take care of the pasture. The prohibition of not allowing others to use it. The prohibition of Stud fees
title_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ فَضْلِ الْمَاءِ الَّذِي يَكُونُ بِالْفَلَاةِ وَيُحْتَاجُ إِلَيْهِ لِرَعْيِ الْكَلَأِ وَتَحْرِيمِ مَنْعِ بَذْلِهِ وَتَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ ضِرَابِ الْفَحْلِ

title: The prohibition of the price of a dog, the fee of a fortuneteller and the payment of a prostitute, and the prohibition of selling cats
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ ثَمَنِ الْكَلْبِ وَحُلْوَانِ الْكَاهِنِ وَمَهْرِ الْبَغِيِّ وَالنَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ السِّنّ

title: The command to kill dogs, and its abrogation. The prohibition of keeping dogs, except for hunting, farming, (herding) livestock and the like
title_ar: بَاب الْأَمْرِ بِقَتْلِ الْكِلَابِ وَبَيَانِ نَسْخِهِ وَبَيَانِ تَحْرِيمِ اقْتِنَائِهَا إِلَّا لِصَيْدٍ أَوْ زَرْعٍ أَوْ مَاشِيَةٍ وَنَحْوِ ذَلِكَ

title: The permissibility of a cupper's earnings
title_ar: باب حِلِّ أُجْرَةِ الْحِجَامَةِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of selling wine
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الْخَمْرِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of selling wine, dead meat, pork and idols
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الْخَمْرِ وَالْمَيْتَةِ وَالْخِنْزِيرِ وَالأَصْنَامِ ‏‏

title: Riba (Usury, Interest)
title_ar: باب الرِّبَا ‏‏

title: Exchange and Selling Gold for Silver on the spot
title_ar: باب الصَّرْفِ وَبَيْعِ الذَّهَبِ بِالْوَرِقِ نَقْدًا ‏‏

title: The Prohibition of selling silver for gold to be paid at a later date
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ الْوَرِقِ، بِالذَّهَبِ دَيْنًا ‏‏

title: Selling a necklace in which there are pearls and gold
title_ar: باب بَيْعِ الْقِلاَدَةِ فِيهَا خَرَزٌ وَذَهَبٌ ‏‏

title: Selling Food Like for Like
title_ar: باب بَيْعِ الطَّعَامِ مِثْلاً بِمِثْلٍ ‏‏

title: Cursing the one who consumes Riba and the one who pays it
title_ar: باب لَعْنِ آكِلِ الرِّبَا وَمُؤْكِلِهِ ‏‏

title: Taking that which is lawful and leaving that which is unclear
title_ar: باب أَخْذِ الْحَلاَلِ وَتَرْكِ الشُّبُهَاتِ ‏‏

title: Selling Camels and Stipulating that one may ride them
title_ar: باب بَيْعِ الْبَعِيرِ وَاسْتِثْنَاءِ رُكُوبِهِ ‏‏

title: It is permissible to lend animals and it is recommended to pay in full, giving something better than that which ts owed
title_ar: باب مَنِ اسْتَسْلَفَ شَيْئًا فَقَضَى خَيْرًا مِنْهُ وَ ‏"‏ خَيْرُكُمْ أَحْسَنُكُمْ قَضَاءً ‏"‏ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of selling animals for animals of the same kind and of different quality
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ بَيْعِ الْحَيَوَانِ بِالْحَيَوَانِ مِنْ جِنْسِهِ مُتَفَاضِلاً ‏‏

title: Pawning (Rahn) and its permissibility whether one is travelling or not
title_ar: باب الرَّهْنِ وَجَوَازِهِ فِي الْحَضَرِ وَالسَّفَرِ ‏‏

title: Salam (Payment in Advance)
title_ar: باب السَّلَمِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of hoarding staple foods
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الاِحْتِكَارِ فِي الأَقْوَاتِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of swearing oaths when selling
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْحَلِفِ، فِي الْبَيْعِ ‏‏

title: Pre-emption
title_ar: باب الشُّفْعَةِ ‏‏

title: Fixing a piece of wood to a neighbor's wall
title_ar: باب غَرْزِ الْخَشَبِ فِي جِدَارِ الْجَارِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of wrongdoing, seizing land unlawfully etc
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الظُّلْمِ وَغَصْبِ الأَرْضِ وَغَيْرِهَا ‏‏

title: The width of the road if there is a dispute about it
title_ar: باب قَدْرِ الطَّرِيقِ إِذَا اخْتَلَفُوا فِيهِ ‏‏
باب

title: Give The Shares Of Inheritance To Those Who Are Entitled To Them, And Whatever Is Left Goes To The Closest Male Relative
title_ar: باب أَلْحِقُوا الْفَرَائِضَ بِأَهْلِهَا فَمَا بَقِيَ فَلأَوْلَى رَجُلٍ ذَكَرٍ ‏‏

title: Inheritance Of The Kalalah
title_ar: باب مِيرَاثِ الْكَلاَلَةِ ‏‏

title: The Last Verse To Be Revealed Was The Verse Of Kalalah
title_ar: باب آخِرِ آيَةٍ أُنْزِلَتْ آيَةُ الْكَلاَلَةِ ‏‏

title: Whoever Leaves Behind Wealth, It Is For His Heirs
title_ar: باب مَنْ تَرَكَ مَالاً فَلِوَرَثَتِهِ ‏‏

title: It Is Disliked For A Man To Buy What He Gave In Charity From The One To Whom He Gave It
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ شِرَاءِ الإِنْسَانِ مَا تَصَدَّقَ بِهِ مِمَّنْ تَصَدَّقَ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Taking Back One's Charity After It Has Been Accepted, Except In The Case Of What A Father Gives To A Son Or Grandson
title_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ الرُّجُوعِ فِي الصَّدَقَةِ وَالْهِبَةِ بَعْدَ الْقَبْضِ إِلَّا مَا وَهَبَهُ لِوَلَدِهِ وَإِنْ سَفَلَ

title: It Is Disliked To Favor Some Of One's Children Over Others In Gift-Giving
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ تَفْضِيلِ بَعْضِ الأَوْلاَدِ فِي الْهِبَةِ ‏‏

title: The 'Umra (Lifelong Gift)
title_ar: باب الْعُمْرَى ‏‏
باب

title: Bequeathing One-Third
title_ar: باب الْوَصِيَّةِ بِالثُّلُثِ ‏‏

title: The Reward For Charity Reaches The Deceased
title_ar: باب وُصُولِ ثَوَابِ الصَّدَقَاتِ إِلَى الْمَيِّتِ ‏‏

title: What Reward Reaches A Man After His Death
title_ar: باب مَا يَلْحَقُ الإِنْسَانَ مِنَ الثَّوَابِ بَعْدَ وَفَاتِهِ ‏‏

title: Waqf (Endowment)
title_ar: باب الْوَقْفِ ‏‏

title: Not Making A Will For One Who Has Nothing To Be Bequeathed
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ الْوَصِيَّةِ لِمَنْ لَيْسَ لَهُ شَىْءٌ يُوصِي فِيهِ ‏‏

title: The Command To Fulfill Vows
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِقَضَاءِ النَّذْرِ ‏‏

title: he Prohibition Of Vows, And Confirmation That They Do Not Avert Anything
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ النَّذْرِ، وَأَنَّهُ، لاَ يَرُدُّ شَيْئًا ‏‏

title: There is no fulfillment of a vow that involves disobedience towards Allah, or a vow concerning that which a person does not own
title_ar: باب لاَ وَفَاءَ لِنَذْرٍ فِي مَعْصِيَةِ اللَّهِ وَلاَ فِيمَا لاَ يَمْلِكُ الْعَبْدُ ‏‏

title: One Who Vows To Walk To The Ka'bah
title_ar: باب مَنْ نَذَرَ أَنْ يَمْشِيَ إِلَى الْكَعْبَةِ ‏‏

title: Expiation For Breaking A Vow
title_ar: باب فِي كَفَّارَةِ النَّذْرِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of swearing by something other than Allah
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْحَلِفِ بِغَيْرِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ‏‏

title: Whoever swears by Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, let him say La Ilaha Illallah
title_ar: باب مَنْ حَلَفَ بِاللاَّتِ وَالْعُزَّى فَلْيَقُلْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ ‏‏

title: It is recommended for the one who swears an oath then sees that something else is better than it; To do that which is better and offer expiation for his oath
title_ar: باب نَدْبِ مَنْ حَلَفَ يَمِينًا فَرَأَى غَيْرَهَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا أَنْ يَأْتِيَ الَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ وَيُكَفِّرَ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ

title: An oath is judged on the intention of the one who asks for it to be sworn.
title_ar: باب يَمِينِ الْحَالِفِ عَلَى نِيَّةِ الْمُسْتَحْلِفِ ‏‏

title: Saying: "If Allah wills" when swearing oaths and at other times
title_ar: باب الاِسْتِثْنَاءِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of persisting in an oath that will harm the family of the one who swears it, so long as not persisting in it does not involve anything unlawful
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الإِصْرَارِ، عَلَى الْيَمِينِ فِيمَا يَتَأَذَّى بِهِ أَهْلُ الْحَالِفِ مِمَّا لَيْسَ بِحَرَامٍ

title: The vow of a disbeliever, and what he should do about it if he becomes a muslim
title_ar: باب نَذْرِ الْكَافِرِ وَمَا يَفْعَلُ فِيهِ إِذَا أَسْلَمَ ‏‏

title: Treatment of slaves, and the expiation of one who slaps his slave
title_ar: باب صُحْبَةِ الْمَمَالِيكِ وَكَفَّارَةِ مَنْ لَطَمَ عَبْدَهُ ‏‏

title: Stern warning against accusing a slave of fornication
title_ar: باب التَّغْلِيظِ عَلَى مَنْ قَذَفَ مَمْلُوكَهُ بِالزِّنَا ‏‏

title: Feeding a slave what one eats and clothing him as one clothes oneself, and not burdening him with more than he bear
title_ar: باب إِطْعَامِ الْمَمْلُوكِ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ وَإِلْبَاسِهِ مَمَّا يَلْبَسُ وَلاَ يُكَلِّفُهُ مَا يَغْلِبُهُ

title: The reward of a slave who is sincere towards his master and worships Allah properly
title_ar: باب ثَوَابِ الْعَبْدِ وَأَجْرِهِ إِذَا نَصَحَ لِسَيِّدِهِ وَأَحْسَنَ عِبَادَةَ اللَّهِ ‏‏

title: One who frees his share in a slave
title_ar: باب مَنْ أَعْتَقَ شِرْكًا لَهُ فِي عَبْدٍ ‏‏

title: Permissibility of selling a Mudabbar
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ بَيْعِ الْمُدَبَّرِ ‏‏

title: Qasamah (Oaths)
title_ar: باب الْقَسَامَةِ

title: The ruling on Muharibin and Apostates
title_ar: باب حُكْمِ الْمُحَارِبِينَ وَالْمُرْتَدِّينَ ‏‏

title: Confirmation of Qisas in the case of killing with a rock and other sharp or heavy objects, and the killing of a man for a woman
title_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ الْقِصَاصِ فِي الْقَتْلِ بِالْحَجَرِ وَغَيْرِهِ مِنَ الْمُحَدَّدَاتِ وَالْمُثَقَّلاَتِ وَقَتْلِ الرَّجُلِ بِالْمَرْأَةِ

title: If a person attacks another person's life and limb, and the other defends himself and kills him or injures him, there is no penalty on him
title_ar: باب الصَّائِلُ عَلَى نَفْسِ الإِنْسَانِ أَوْ عُضْوِهِ إِذَا دَفَعَهُ الْمَصُولُ عَلَيْهِ فَأَتْلَفَ نَفْسَهُ أَوْ عُضْوَهَ لاَ ضَمَانَ عَلَيْهِ

title: The validity of Qisas for teeth and the like
title_ar: باب إِثْبَاتِ الْقِصَاصِ فِي الأَسْنَانِ وَمَا فِي مَعْنَاهَا ‏‏

title: When it is permissible to shed the blood of a muslim
title_ar: باب مَا يُبَاحُ بِهِ دَمُ الْمُسْلِمِ ‏‏

title: The sin of the one who set the precedent of killing
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ إِثْمِ مَنْ سَنَّ الْقَتْلَ ‏‏

title: The punishment for bloodshed in the hereafter, and bloodshed will be the first thing concerning which judgement is passed among the people on the Day of Resurrection
title_ar: باب الْمُجَازَاةِ بِالدِّمَاءِ فِي الآخِرَةِ وَأَنَّهَا أَوَّلُ مَا يُقْضَى فِيهِ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

title: Emphasis on the sanctity of Blood, Honor and Wealth
title_ar: باب تَغْلِيظِ تَحْرِيمِ الدِّمَاءِ وَالأَعْرَاضِ وَالأَمْوَالِ ‏‏

title: A confession to murder is valid and the heir of the victim is entitled to Qisas, but it is recommended to ask him to let him go
title_ar: باب صِحَّةِ الإِقْرَارِ بِالْقَتْلِ وَتَمْكِينِ وَلِيِّ الْقَتِيلِ مِنَ الْقِصَاصِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ طَلَبِ الْعَفْوِ مِنْهُ

title: The Diyah for a fetus; and the Diyah for accidental killing and the ambiguous killing must be paid by the shahiqilah of the killer
title_ar: باب دِيَةِ الْجَنِينِ وَوُجُوبِ الدِّيَةِ فِي قَتْلِ الْخَطَإِ وَشِبْهِ الْعَمْدِ عَلَى عَاقِلَةِ الْجَانِي

title: The Hadd for stealing and the minimum threshold
title_ar: باب حَدِّ السَّرِقَةِ وَنِصَابِهَا ‏‏

title: Cutting off the hand of a thief from the nobility and others; the prohibition of interceding with regard to Hudud punishments
title_ar: باب قَطْعِ السَّارِقِ الشَّرِيفِ وَغَيْرِهِ وَالنَّهْىِ عَنِ الشَّفَاعَةِ فِي الْحُدُودِ ‏‏

title: The Hadd punishment for Zina (fornication, adultery)
title_ar: باب حَدِّ الزِّنَا ‏‏

title: Stoning of a married person for Zina
title_ar: باب رَجْمِ الثَّيِّبِ فِي الزِّنَا ‏‏

title: One who confesses to Zina
title_ar: باب مَنِ اعْتَرَفَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ بِالزِّنَا ‏‏

title: Stoning Jews and Ahl Adh-Dhimmah for Zina
title_ar: باب رَجْمِ الْيَهُودِ أَهْلِ الذِّمَّةِ فِي الزِّنَا ‏‏

title: Delaying the Hadd punishment in the case of women who have just given birth
title_ar: باب تَأْخِيرِ الْحَدِّ عَنِ النُّفَسَاءِ، ‏‏

title: Hadd punishment for drinking alcohol
title_ar: باب حَدِّ الْخَمْرِ ‏‏

title: Number of lashes in the case of ta'zeer
title_ar: باب قَدْرِ أَسْوَاطِ التَّعْزِيرِ

title: The Hadd punishments are an expiation for those on whom they are carried out
title_ar: باب الْحُدُودُ كَفَّارَاتٌ لأَهْلِهَا ‏‏

title: There is no Diyah for injuries caused by animals or by falling into a mine or well
title_ar: باب جَرْحُ الْعَجْمَاءِ وَالْمَعْدِنِ وَالْبِئْرِ جُبَارٌ ‏‏

title: Oath should be sworn by the defendant
title_ar: باب الْيَمِينُ عَلَى الْمُدَّعَى عَلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: The obligation of judging on the basis of a witness and an oath
title_ar: باب الْقَضَاءِ بِالْيَمِينِ وَالشَّاهِدِ ‏‏

title: So the judgement of the judge does not change what happened
title_ar: باب الْحُكْمِ بِالظَّاهِرِ وَاللَّحْنِ بِالْحُجَّةِ ‏‏

title: The case of Hind
title_ar: باب قَضِيَّةِ هِنْدٍ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of asking too much with no need. The prohibition of withholding the rights of others and asking of them, which means refusing to give others their rights and asking for that to which one is not entitles
title_ar: باب النَّهْيِ عَنْ كَثْرَةِ الْمَسَائِلِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَاجَةٍ وَالنَّهْيِ عَنْ مَنْعٍ وَهَاتٍ وَهُوَ الاِمْتِنَاعُ مِنْ أَدَاءِ حَقٍّ لَزِمَهُ أَوْ طَلَبُ مَا لاَ يَسْتَحِقُّهُ

title: The reward of the judge if he strives to reach a decision, whether he gets it right or wrong
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَجْرِ الْحَاكِمِ إِذَا اجْتَهَدَ فَأَصَابَ أَوْ أَخْطَأَ ‏‏

title: It is disliked for a judge to pass a judgement when he is angry
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ قَضَاءِ الْقَاضِي وَهُوَ غَضْبَانُ ‏‏

title: Rejection of wrong rulings and of newly-invented matters
title_ar: باب نَقْضِ الأَحْكَامِ الْبَاطِلَةِ وَرَدِّ مُحْدَثَاتِ الأُمُورِ ‏‏

title: The best of witnesses
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ خَيْرِ الشُّهُودِ ‏‏

title: Differences between mujtahids
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ اخْتِلاَفِ الْمُجْتَهِدِينَ ‏‏

title: It is recommended for a judge to reconcile between disputants
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ إِصْلاَحِ الْحَاكِمِ بَيْنَ الْخَصْمَيْنِ ‏‏

title: Picking up property lost by a pilgrim
title_ar: باب

title: Milking animals is unlawful if the owner has not given permission
title_ar: باب فِي لُقَطَةِ الْحَاجِّ ‏‏

title: Hospitality etc
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ حَلْبِ الْمَاشِيَةِ بِغَيْرِ إِذْنِ مَالِكِهَا ‏‏

title: It is recommended to spend surplus wealth
title_ar: باب الضِّيَافَةِ وَنَحْوِهَا ‏‏

title: It is recommended to mix provisions if they are few, and to share them out
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْمُؤَاسَاةِ بِفُضُولِ الْمَالِ ‏‏
باب اسْتِحْبَابِ خَلْطِ الأَزْوَادِ إِذَا قَلَّتْ وَالْمُؤَاسَاةِ فِيهَا ‏‏

title: Permissibility of raiding the Kuffar, who have been reached with the call of Islam, without giving prior warning
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الإِغَارَةِ عَلَى الْكُفَّارِ الَّذِينَ بَلَغَتْهُمْ دَعْوَةُ الإِسْلاَمِ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَقَدُّمِ الإِعْلاَمِ بِالإِغَارَةِ

title: Ruler appointing leaders of expeditions and advising them of the etiquette of war, etc.
title_ar: باب تَأْمِيرِ الإِمَامِ الأُمَرَاءَ عَلَى الْبُعُوثِ وَوَصِيَّتِهِ إِيَّاهُمْ بِآدَابِ الْغَزْوِ وَغَيْرِهَا

title: The command to show leniency and avoid causing aversion (towards Islam)
