title_ar: باب فِي الأَمْرِ بِالتَّيْسِيرِ وَتَرْكِ التَّنْفِيرِ

title: The prohibition of betrayal
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْغَدْرِ ‏‏

title: Permissibility of deceit in war
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْخِدَاعِ فِي الْحَرْبِ ‏‏

title: It is disliked to wish to meet the enemy, and the command to be steadfast when meeting the enemy
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ تَمَنِّي لِقَاءِ الْعَدُوِّ وَالأَمْرِ بِالصَّبْرِ عِنْدَ اللِّقَاءِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to pray for victory when meeting the enemy
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الدُّعَاءِ بِالنَّصْرِ عِنْدَ لِقَاءِ الْعَدُوِّ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of killing women and children in war
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ قَتْلِ النِّسَاءِ وَالصِّبْيَانِ فِي الْحَرْبِ ‏‏

title: Permissibility of killing women and children in night raids, so long as it is not done deliberately
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ قَتْلِ النِّسَاءِ وَالصِّبْيَانِ فِي الْبَيَاتِ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَعَمُّدٍ ‏‏

title: Permissibility of cutting down the trees of the Kuffar and burning them
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ قَطْعِ أَشْجَارِ الْكُفَّارِ وَتَحْرِيقِهَا ‏‏

title: War booty has been made permissible for this Ummah only
title_ar: باب تَحْلِيلِ الْغَنَائِمِ لِهَذِهِ الأُمَّةِ خَاصَّةً ‏‏

title: Spoils of War
title_ar: باب الأَنْفَالِ ‏‏

title: The killer is entitled to the belongings of the one who is killed
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْقَاقِ الْقَاتِلِ سَلَبَ الْقَتِيلِ ‏‏

title: Additional rewards, and ransoming muslims in return for prisoners
title_ar: باب التَّنْفِيلِ وَفِدَاءِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ بِالأَسَارَى ‏‏

title: Ruling on Fai' (Booty acquired without fighting)
title_ar: باب حُكْمِ الْفَىْءِ ‏‏

title: The words of the Prophet (ﷺ): "We (Prophets) have no heirs and whatever we leave behind is charity."
title_ar: باب قَوْلِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏"‏ لاَ نُورَثُ مَا تَرَكْنَا فَهُوَ صَدَقَةٌ ‏"‏ ‏‏

title: How booty is to be shared among the fighters
title_ar: باب كَيْفِيَّةِ قِسْمَةِ الْغَنِيمَةِ بَيْنَ الْحَاضِرِينَ ‏‏

title: The support of the angels during the Battle of Badr, and the permissibility of the spoils
title_ar: باب الإِمْدَادِ بِالْمَلاَئِكَةِ فِي غَزْوَةِ بَدْرٍ وَإِبَاحَةِ الْغَنَائِمِ ‏‏

title: Tying up and detaining captives, and the permissibility of releasing them without a ransom
title_ar: باب رَبْطِ الأَسِيرِ وَحَبْسِهِ وَجَوَازِ الْمَنِّ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: Expulsion of the Jews from the Hijaz
title_ar: باب إِجْلاَءِ الْيَهُودِ مِنَ الْحِجَازِ ‏‏

title: Expulsion of Jews and Christians from the Arabian Peninsula
title_ar: باب إِخْرَاجِ الْيَهُودِ وَالنَّصَارَى مِنْ جَزِيرَةِ الْعَرَبِ ‏‏

title: Permissibility of fighting those who break a treaty; Permissibility of letting besieged people surrender, subject to the judgement of a just person who is qualified to pass judgement
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ قِتَالِ مَنْ نَقَضَ الْعَهْدَ وَجَوَازِ إِنْزَالِ أَهْلِ الْحِصْنِ عَلَى حُكْمِ حَاكِمٍ عَدْلٍ أَهْلٍ لِلْحُكْمِ

title: Hastening to fight, and giving precedence to the more urgent of two tasks when a choice must be made
title_ar: باب مَنْ لَزِمَهُ أَمْرٌ فَدَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ أَمْرٌ آخَرُ ‏‏

title: The Muhajirun returned to the Ansar the gifts of trees and fruits when they became independent of means through the conquests
title_ar: باب رَدِّ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ إِلَى الأَنْصَارِ مَنَائِحَهُمْ مِنَ الشَّجَرِ وَالثَّمَرِ حِينَ اسْتَغْنَوْا عَنْهَا بِالْفُتُوحِ

title: Permissibility of eating food seized as booty in Dar Al-Harb
title_ar: باب أَخْذِ الطَّعَامِ مِنْ أَرْضِ الْعَدُوِّ ‏‏

title: The Prophet (ﷺ) wrote to Heraclius, the ruler of Syria, inviting him to Islam
title_ar: باب كِتَابِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى هِرَقْلَ يَدْعُوهُ إِلَى الإِسْلاَمِ ‏‏

title: The Prophet (ﷺ) wrote to the Kings of the Kuffar, inviting them to Islam
title_ar: باب كُتُبِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى مُلُوكِ الْكُفَّارِ يَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ

title: The Battle of Hunain
title_ar: باب فِي غَزْوَةِ حُنَيْنٍ ‏‏

title: The Battle of At-Ta'if
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ الطَّائِفِ ‏‏

title: The Battle of Badr
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ بَدْرٍ ‏‏

title: The conquest of Makkah
title_ar: باب فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ ‏‏

title: Removal of Idols from around the Ka'bah
title_ar: باب إِزَالَةِ الأَصْنَامِ مِنْ حَوْلِ الْكَعْبَةِ ‏‏

title: No man if Quraish is to be captured then killed, after the conquest
title_ar: باب لاَ يُقْتَلُ قُرَشِيٌّ صَبْرًا بَعْدَ الْفَتْحِ ‏‏

title: The truce of Al-Hudaybiyah
title_ar: باب صُلْحِ الْحُدَيْبِيَةِ فِي الْحُدَيْبِيَةِ ‏‏

title: Upholding Covenants
title_ar: باب الْوَفَاءِ بِالْعَهْدِ ‏‏

title: The Battle of Al-Ahzab (The Confederates)
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ الأَحْزَابِ ‏‏

title: The Battle of Uhud
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ أُحُدٍ ‏‏

title: The intense wrath of Allah towards the one who was killed by the messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
title_ar: باب اشْتِدَادِ غَضَبِ اللَّهِ عَلَى مَنْ قَتَلَهُ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏‏

title: The persecution suffered by the prophet (ﷺ) at the hands of the idolaters and hypocrites
title_ar: باب مَا لَقِيَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِنْ أَذَى الْمُشْرِكِينَ وَالْمُنَافِقِينَ ‏‏

title: The supplication of the Prophet (ﷺ) and his steadfastness in the face of the hypocrites' persecution
title_ar: باب فِي دُعَاءِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى اللَّهِ وَصَبْرِهِ عَلَى أَذَى الْمُنَافِقِينَ

title: The slaying of Abu Jahl
title_ar: باب قَتْلِ أَبِي جَهْلٍ ‏‏

title: The slaying of Ka'b Bin Al-Ashraf, the Tagut of the Jews
title_ar: باب قَتْلِ كَعْبِ بْنِ الأَشْرَفِ طَاغُوتِ الْيَهُودِ ‏‏

title: The Battle of Khaibar
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ خَيْبَرَ ‏‏

title: The Battle of Al-Ahzab (The Confederates), also known as Al-Khandaq (The Ditch)
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ الأَحْزَابِ وَهِيَ الْخَنْدَقُ ‏‏

title: The Battle of Dhu Qarad and other battles
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ ذِي قَرَدٍ وَغَيْرِهَا ‏‏

title: The words of Allah, the Most High: "And He it is who has withheld their hands from you"
title_ar: باب قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى: {وَهُوَ الَّذِي كَفَّ أَيْدِيَهُمْ عَنْكُمْ} الآيَةَ:

title: Women participating in military expeditions with the men
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ النِّسَاءِ مَعَ الرِّجَالِ ‏‏

title: Women who take part in military expeditions are to be given a reward but not a regular share; And the prohibition of killing children of the enemy
title_ar: باب النِّسَاءُ الْغَازِيَاتُ يُرْضَخُ لَهُنَّ وَلاَ يُسْهَمُ وَالنَّهْىُ عَنْ قَتْلِ صِبْيَانِ أَهْلِ الْحَرْبِ

title: The number of campaigns of the Prophet (ﷺ)
title_ar: باب عَدَدِ غَزَوَاتِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم

title: The campaign of Dhat Ar-Riqa
title_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ ذَاتِ الرِّقَاعِ

title: It is disliked to seek the help of a disbeliever in wars (except in cases of necessity, or if he thinks well of the Muslims)
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الاِسْتِعَانَةِ فِي الْغَزْوِ بِكَافِرٍ

title: The people follow the Quraish and the Caliphate belongs to the Quraish
title_ar: باب النَّاسُ تَبَعٌ لِقُرَيْشٍ وَالْخِلاَفَةُ فِي قُرَيْشٍ ‏‏

title: Appointing a successor or not doing so
title_ar: باب الاِسْتِخْلاَفِ وَتَرْكِهِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of seeking or desiring a position of authority
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ طَلَبِ الإِمَارَةِ، وَالْحِرْصِ، عَلَيْهَا ‏‏

title: It is disliked to be appointed to a position of authority unnecessarily
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الإِمَارَةِ بِغَيْرِ ضَرُورَةٍ ‏‏

title: The virtue of a just ruler and the punishment of a tyrant; Encouragement to treat those under one's authority with kindness and the prohibition against causing them hardship
title_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ الإِمَامِ الْعَادِلِ وَعُقُوبَةِ الْجَائِرِ وَالْحَثِّ عَلَى الرِّفْقِ بِالرَّعِيَّةِ وَالنَّهْيِ عَنْ إِدْخَالِ الْمَشَقَّةِ عَلَيْهِمْ

title: Emphatic prohibition against stealing from the spoils of war (Ghulul)
title_ar: باب غِلَظِ تَحْرِيمِ الْغُلُولِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of giving gifts to agents
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ هَدَايَا الْعُمَّالِ ‏‏

title: The obligation of obeying leaders in matters that do not involve sin, but it is forbidden to obey them in sinful matters
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ طَاعَةِ الأُمَرَاءِ فِي غَيْرِ مَعْصِيَةٍ وَتَحْرِيمِهَا فِي الْمَعْصِيَةِ ‏‏

title: The ruler is a shield from behind whom they fight and by whom they are protected
title_ar: باب فِي الإِمَامِ إِذَا أَمَرَ بِتَقْوَى اللَّهِ وَعَدَلَ كَانَ لَهُ أَجْرٌ ‏‏

title: The obligation of fulfilling oaths of allegiance is owed to the first of two Caliphs
title_ar: باب الْوَفَاءِ بِبَيْعَةِ الْخُلَفَاءِ الأَوَّلِ فَالأَوَّلِ ‏‏

title: The command to be patient in the face of oppressive rulers and their selfishness
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِالصَّبْرِ عِنْدَ ظُلْمِ الْوُلاَةِ وَاسْتِئْثَارِهِمْ ‏‏

title: Obeying Rulers even if they withhold the people's rights
title_ar: باب فِي طَاعَةِ الأُمَرَاءِ وَإِنْ مَنَعُوا الْحُقُوقَ

title: The obligation of staying with the Jama'ah (main body) of the muslims when Fitn (tribulations) appear, and in all circumstances. The prohibition of refusing to obey and on splitting away from the Jama'ah
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِلُزُومِ الْجَمَاعَةِ عِنْدَ ظُهُورِ الْفِتَنِ وَتَحْذِيرِ الدُّعَاةِ إِلَى الْكُفْرِ ‏‏

title: The ruling on one who seeks to divide the muslims when they are united
title_ar: باب حُكْمِ مَنْ فَرَّقَ أَمْرَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ وَهُوَ مُجْتَمِعٌ ‏‏

title: When allegiance has been sworn to two caliphs
title_ar: باب إِذَا بُويِعَ لِخَلِيفَتَيْنِ ‏‏

title: The obligation to denounce rulers for that in which they go against Shari'ah, but they should not be fought so long as they pray regularly, etc
title_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الإِنْكَارِ عَلَى الأُمَرَاءِ فِيمَا يُخَالِفُ الشَّرْعَ وَتَرْكِ قِتَالِهِمْ مَا صَلَّوْا وَنَحْوِ ذَلِكَ

title: The best and worst of rulers
title_ar: باب خِيَارِ الأَئِمَّةِ وَشِرَارِهِمْ ‏‏

title: It is recommended for the army to swear allegiance to the ruler when intending to fight, and an account of Bay'at Ar-Ridwan beneath the tree
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ مُبَايَعَةِ الإِمَامِ الْجَيْشَ عِنْدَ إِرَادَةِ الْقِتَالِ وَبَيَانِ بَيْعَةِ الرِّضْوَانِ تَحْتَ الشَّجَرَةِ

title: The prohibition against a Muhajir returning to settle in his former homeland
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ رُجُوعِ الْمُهَاجِرِ إِلَى اسْتِيطَانِ وَطَنِهِ ‏‏

title: Swearing Allegiance and Pledging to adhere to Islam, to engage in Jihad and to do Good, after the conquest of Makkah, and the meaning of the phrase: "There is No Hijrah (migration) after the Conquest."
title_ar: باب الْمُبَايَعَةِ بَعْدَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ عَلَى الإِسْلاَمِ وَالْجِهَادِ وَالْخَيْرِ وَبَيَانِ مَعْنَى: «لاَ هِجْرَةَ بَعْدَ الْفَتْحِ»

title: How women gave their oath of allegiance
title_ar: باب كَيْفِيَّةِ بَيْعَةِ النِّسَاءِ ‏‏

title: Oath of allegiance pledging to hear and obey as much as possible
title_ar: باب الْبَيْعَةِ عَلَى السَّمْعِ وَالطَّاعَةِ فِيمَا اسْتَطَاعَ ‏‏

title: The age of responsibility
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ سِنِّ الْبُلُوغِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of travelling with the Mushaf to the land of the disbelievers if there is the fear that it may fall into their hands.
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ أَنْ يُسَافَرَ بِالْمُصْحَفِ إِلَى أَرْضِ الْكُفَّارِ إِذَا خِيفَ وُقُوعُهُ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ

title: Horse Races and Training Horses for Racing
title_ar: باب الْمُسَابَقَةِ بَيْنَ الْخَيْلِ وَتَضْمِيرِهَا ‏‏

title: The virtue of horses; "Goodness is tied to their Forelocks."
title_ar: باب الْخَيْلُ فِي نَوَاصِيهَا الْخَيْرُ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ‏‏

title: Disliked qualities in Horses
title_ar: باب مَا يُكْرَهُ مِنْ صِفَاتِ الْخَيْلِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of Jihad and going out (to fight) in the cause of Allah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْجِهَادِ وَالْخُرُوجِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of Martyrdom in the cause of Allah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الشَّهَادَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ‏‏

title: The virtue of going out in the morning or the evening in the cause of Allah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْغَدْوَةِ وَالرَّوْحَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ‏‏

title: The High Positions that Allah has prepared for the Mujahid in Paradise
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ مَا أَعَدَّهُ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى لِلْمُجَاهِدِ فِي الْجَنَّةِ مِنَ الدَّرَجَاتِ ‏‏

title: If a person is killed in the cause of Allah, all his sins will be expiated except debt
title_ar: باب مَنْ قُتِلَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ كُفِّرَتْ خَطَايَاهُ إِلاَّ الدَّيْنَ ‏‏

title: The souls of the martyrs are in Paradise, and they are alive with their Lord and they have provision
title_ar: باب فِي بَيَانِ أَنَّ أَرْوَاحَ الشُّهَدَاءِ فِي الْجَنَّةِ وَأَنَّهُمْ أَحْيَاءٌ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ يُرْزَقُونَ

title: The virtue of Jihad and keeping watch over the frontier
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْجِهَادِ وَالرِّبَاطِ ‏‏

title: Two Men, one of whom kills the other, and both will enter Paradise
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ الرَّجُلَيْنِ يَقْتُلُ أَحَدُهُمَا الآخَرَ يَدْخُلاَنِ الْجَنَّةَ ‏‏

title: One who kills a disbeliever then keeps to the right path
title_ar: باب مَنْ قَتَلَ كَافِرًا ثُمَّ سَدَّدَ ‏‏

title: The virtue of Charity in the Cause of Allah, and its Manifold reward
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصَّدَقَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَتَضْعِيفِهَا ‏‏

title: The virtue of helping the warrior who is fighting in the cause of Allah with mounts etc., and looking after his family in his absence
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ إِعَانَةِ الْغَازِي فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ بِمَرْكُوبٍ وَغَيْرِهِ وَخِلاَفَتِهِ فِي أَهْلِهِ بِخَيْرٍ

title: The sanctity of the wives of the Mujahidin, and the sin of the one who betrays them with regard to them
title_ar: باب حُرْمَةِ نِسَاءِ الْمُجَاهِدِينَ وَإِثْمِ مَنْ خَانَهُمْ فِيهِنَّ ‏‏

title: The duty of Jihad is waived for those who have excuses
title_ar: باب سُقُوطِ فَرْضِ الْجِهَادِ عَنِ الْمَعْذُورِينَ، ‏‏

title: Affirmation of Paradise for the Martyr
title_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ الْجَنَّةِ لِلشَّهِيدِ ‏‏

title: One who fights so that the word of Allah will be supreme is fighting in the cause of Allah
title_ar: باب مَنْ قَاتَلَ لِتَكُونَ كَلِمَةُ اللَّهِ هِيَ الْعُلْيَا فَهُوَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ‏‏

title: One who fights to show off and gain a reputation deserves Hell
title_ar: باب مَنَ قَاتَلَ لِلرِّيَاءِ وَالسُّمْعَةِ اسْتَحَقَّ النَّارَ ‏‏

title: The reward of those who fought and acquired spoils of war and those who did not acquire spoils of war
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ قَدْرِ ثَوَابِ مَنْ غَزَا فَغَنِمَ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَغْنَمْ ‏‏

title: The words of the prophets ﷺ: "Deeds are but with intentions" which includes fighting and other deeds
title_ar: باب قَوْلِهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏"‏ إِنَّمَا الأَعْمَالُ بِالنِّيَّةِ.‏"‏ وَأَنَّهُ يَدْخُلُ فِيهِ الْغَزْوُ وَغَيْرُهُ مِنَ الأَعْمَالِ

title: It is recommended to seek Martyrdom in the Cause of Allah, Exalted is He.
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ طَلَبِ الشَّهَادَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ‏‏

title: Criticism of one who dies without having fought (in Jihad) or having thought of fighting
title_ar: باب ذَمِّ مَنْ مَاتَ وَلَمْ يَغْزُ وَلَمْ يُحَدِّثْ نَفْسَهُ بِالْغَزْوِ ‏‏

title: The reward of one who is kept from fighting by sickness or any other excuse
title_ar: باب ثَوَابِ مَنْ حَبَسَهُ عَنِ الْغَزْوِ، مَرَضٌ أَوْ عُذْرٌ آخَرُ ‏‏

title: The virtue of campaigning by sea
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْغَزْوِ فِي الْبَحْرِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of guarding the frontier in the cause of Allah (Glorified and Exalted is He)
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الرِّبَاطِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ ‏‏

title: About the Martyrs
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ الشُّهَدَاءِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of Shooting and Encouragement to learn it, and criticism of the one who learns it and then forgets it
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الرَّمْىِ وَالْحَثِّ عَلَيْهِ وَذَمِّ مَنْ عَلِمَهُ ثُمَّ نَسِيَهُ ‏‏

title: The words of the prophet ﷺ: "A Group of my Ummah will continue to Prevail on the basis of the Truth, and They will not be Harmed by those who oppose them."
title_ar: باب قَوْلِهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: «لاَ تَزَالُ طَائِفَةٌ مِنْ أُمَّتِي ظَاهِرِينَ عَلَى الْحَقِّ لاَ يَضُرُّهُمْ مَنْ خَالَفَهُمْ»

title: Keeping animals' well being in mind when traveling, and the prohibition of halting in the road at the end of the night.
title_ar: باب مُرَاعَاةِ مَصْلَحَةِ الدَّوَابِّ فِي السَّيْرِ وَالنَّهْىِ عَنِ التَّعْرِيسِ فِي الطَّرِيقِ ‏‏

title: Travel is a kind of torment, and it is recommended for the traveler to hasten back to his family after finishing his business
title_ar: باب السَّفَرِ قِطْعَةٌ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ تَعْجِيلِ الْمُسَافِرِ إِلَى أَهْلِهِ بَعْدَ قَضَاءِ شُغْلِهِ

title: It is disliked to enter at night when coming home from a journey
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الطُّرُوقِ وَهُوَ الدُّخُولُ لَيْلاً لِمَنْ وَرَدَ مِنْ سَفَرٍ ‏‏

title: Hunting with trained dogs and arrows
title_ar: باب الصَّيْدِ بِالْكِلاَبِ الْمُعَلَّمَةِ ‏‏

title: If the game disappears, then is found afterwards
title_ar: باب إِذَا غَابَ عَنْهُ الصَّيْدُ ثُمَّ وَجَدَهُ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of eating any wild animal with Fangs and any bird with Talons
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ أَكْلِ كُلِّ ذِي نَابٍ مِنَ السِّبَاعِ وَكُلِّ ذِي مِخْلَبٍ مِنَ الطَّيْرِ ‏‏

title: Permissibility of dead animals from the sea
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ مَيْتَاتِ الْبَحْرِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of eating the meat of domesticated donkeys
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ أَكْلِ لَحْمِ الْحُمُرِ الإِنْسِيَّةِ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of eating horse meat
title_ar: باب فِي أَكْلِ لُحُومِ الْخَيْلِ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of eating the Dabb (mastigure)
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الضَّبِّ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of eating Locusts
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الْجَرَادِ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of eating Rabbit
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الأَرْنَبِ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of using things that help in hunting and pursuing the enemy, but throwing small pebbles is disliked
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ مَا يُسْتَعَانُ بِهِ عَلَى الاِصْطِيَادِ وَالْعَدُوِّ وَكَرَاهَةِ الْخَذْفِ ‏‏

title: The command to be proficient in slaughtering and killing, and to sharpen the blade
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِإِحْسَانِ الذَّبْحِ وَالْقَتْلِ وَتَحْدِيدِ الشَّفْرَةِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of cornering animals in order to kill them (for sport)
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ صَبْرِ الْبَهَائِمِ، ‏‏

title: The time for sacrifice
title_ar: باب وَقْتِهَا ‏‏

title: The age of sacrificial animals
title_ar: باب سِنِّ الأُضْحِيَةِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to select a good animal for the sacrifice and to slaughter it oneself, not delegating it to anyone else, and to say the name of Allah, and to say the Takbir
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الضَّحِيَّةِ وَذَبْحِهَا مُبَاشَرَةً بِلاَ تَوْكِيلٍ وَالتَّسْمِيَةِ وَالتَّكْبِيرِ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of slaughtering with anything that makes the blood flow, except teeth and other bones
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ الذَّبْحِ بِكُلِّ مَا أَنْهَرَ الدَّمَ إِلاَّ السِّنَّ وَالظُّفُرَ وَسَائِرَ الْعِظَامِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of eating sacrificial meat for more than three days, which applied at the beginning of Islam but was then abrogated, and now it is permissible to eat it as long as one wants.
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ مَا كَانَ مِنَ النَّهْىِ عَنْ أَكْلِ لُحُومِ الأَضَاحِيِّ بَعْدَ ثَلاَثٍ فِي أَوَّلِ الإِسْلاَمِ وَبَيَانِ نَسْخِهِ وَإِبَاحَتِهِ إِلَى مَتَى شَاءَ

title: Fara' and 'Atirah
title_ar: باب الْفَرَعِ وَالْعَتِيرَةِ ‏‏

title: When the first ten days of Dhul-Hijjah begin, it is forbidden for the one who wants to offer a sacrifice to remove anything from his hair, nails or skin
title_ar: باب نَهْيِ مَنْ دَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ عَشْرُ ذِي الْحِجَّةِ وَهُوَ مُرِيدُ التَّضْحِيَةِ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْ شَعْرِهِ أَوْ أَظْفَارِهِ شَيْئًا

title: The prohibition of slaughtering a sacrifice for anything other than Allah, and the one who does that is cursed
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الذَّبْحِ لِغَيْرِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى وَلَعْنِ فَاعِلِهِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of Khamr, which may be made from the juice of grapes, dried dates, unripe dates, raisins and other things that intoxicate
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْخَمْرِ وَبَيَانِ أَنَّهَا تَكُونُ مِنْ عَصِيرِ الْعِنَبِ وَمِنَ التَّمْرِ وَالْبُسْرِ وَالزَّبِيبِ وَغَيْرِهَا مِمَّا يُسْكِرُ

title: The prohibition of making vinegar from wine
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ تَخْلِيلِ الْخَمْرِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of using Khamr as a remedy; It is not a remedy
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ التَّدَاوِي بِالْخَمْرِ ‏‏

title: Everything that is taken from the date palm or grape vine and steeped is called Khamr
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ جَمِيعَ مَا يُنْبَذُ مِمَّا يُتَّخَذُ مِنَ النَّخْلِ وَالْعِنَبِ يُسَمَّى خَمْرًا ‏‏

title: It is disliked to make Nabidh by mixing dried dates and raisins
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ انْتِبَاذِ التَّمْرِ وَالزَّبِيبِ مَخْلُوطَيْنِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of making Nabidh in Al-Muzaffat, Ad-Dubba' (Gourds), Al-Hantam and An-Naqir; This has been abrogated and now it is permitted, so long as it does not become intoxicating
title_ar: باب النَّهْيِ عَنْ الاِنْتِبَاذِ فِي الْمُزَفَّتِ وَالدُّبَّاءِ وَالْحَنْتَمِ وَالنَّقِيرِ وَبَيَانِ أَنَّهُ مَنْسُوخٌ وَأَنَّهُ الْيَوْمَ حَلاَلٌ مَا لَمْ يَصِرْ مُسْكِرًا

title: Every intoxicant is Khamr and all Khamr is Haram
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ كُلَّ مُسْكِرٍ خَمْرٌ وَأَنَّ كُلَّ خَمْرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏‏

title: The punishment of one who drinks Khamr if he does not repent from it: he will be denied it in the hereafter
title_ar: باب عُقُوبَةِ مَنْ شَرِبَ الْخَمْرَ إِذَا لَمْ يَتُبْ مِنْهَا بِمَنْعِهِ إِيَّاهَا فِي الآخِرَةِ ‏‏

title: The permissibility of Nabidh so long as it has not become strong and has not become intoxicating
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ النَّبِيذِ الَّذِي لَمْ يَشْتَدَّ وَلَمْ يَصِرْ مُسْكِرًا ‏‏

title: The permissibility of drinking milk
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ شُرْبِ اللَّبَنِ ‏‏

title: Drinking Nabidh and covering vessels
title_ar: باب فِي شُرْبِ النَّبِيذِ وَتَخْمِيرِ الإِنَاءِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to cover vessels, tie up waterskins, close doors and mention the name of Allah over them, extinguish lamps and fires when going to sleep, and keep children and animals in after maghrib
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِتَغْطِيَةِ الإِنَاءِ وَإِيكَاءِ السِّقَاءِ وَإِغْلاَقِ الأَبْوَابِ وَذِكْرِ اسْمِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهَا وَإِطْفَاءِ السِّرَاجِ وَالنَّارِ عِنْدَ النَّوْمِ وَكَفِّ الصِّبْيَانِ وَالْمَوَاشِي بَعْدَ الْمَغْرِبِ

title: The etiquette of eating and drinking, and rulings thereon
title_ar: باب آدَابِ الطَّعَامِ وَالشَّرَابِ وَأَحْكَامِهِمَا ‏‏

title: Drinking while standing
title_ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ الشُّرْبِ قَائِمًا ‏‏

title: Drinking zamzam water while standing
title_ar: باب فِي الشُّرْبِ مِنْ زَمْزَمَ قَائِمًا ‏‏

title: It is disliked to breathe into the vessel, and it is recommended to take three breaths, outside the vessel
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ التَّنَفُّسِ فِي نَفْسِ الإِنَاءِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ التَّنَفُّسِ ثَلاَثًا خَارِجَ الإِنَاءِ

title: It is recommended to pass water and milk etc., to the right of the one who drinks first
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ إِدَارَةِ الْمَاءِ وَاللَّبَنِ وَنَحْوِهِمَا عَنْ يَمِينِ الْمُبْتَدِئِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to lick one's fingers and wipe the bowl, and to eat a piece of food that is dropped after removing any dirt on it. It is disliked to wipe one's hand before licking it, because of the possibility that the blessing of the food may be in that remaining part. The Sunnah is to eat with three fingers
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ لَعْقِ الأَصَابِعِ وَالْقَصْعَةِ وَأَكْلِ اللُّقْمَةِ السَّاقِطَةِ بَعْدَ مَسْحِ مَا يُصِيبُهَا مِنْ أَذًى وَكَرَاهَةِ مَسْحِ الْيَدِ قَبْلَ لَعْقِهَا

title: What the guest should do if he is accompanied by someone who was not invited by the host; it is recommended for the host to give permission to the one who has accompanied the guest
title_ar: باب مَا يَفْعَلُ الضَّيْفُ إِذَا تَبِعَهُ غَيْرُ مَنْ دَعَاهُ صَاحِبُ الطَّعَامِ وَاسْتِحْبَابُ إِذْنِ صَاحِبِ الطَّعَامِ لِلتَّابِعِ

title: It is permissible to take someone else to the house of one who you are certain will approve of that and will not mind. It is recommended to gather to eat
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ اسْتِتْبَاعِهِ غَيْرَهُ إِلَى دَارِ مَنْ يَثِقُ بِرِضَاهُ بِذَلِكَ وَيَتَحَقَّقُهُ تَحَقُّقًا تَامًّا وَاسْتِحْبَابِ الاِجْتِمَاعِ عَلَى الطَّعَامِ

title: It is permissible to eat soup, and it is recommended to eat squash, And for the people eating together to show preference to one another even if they are guests, so long as the host does not object to that
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ أَكْلِ الْمَرَقِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ أَكْلِ الْيَقْطِينِ وَإِيثَارِ أَهْلِ الْمَائِدَةِ بَعْضِهِمْ بَعْضًا وَإِنْ كَانُوا ضِيفَانًا إِذَا لَمْ يَكْرَهْ ذَلِكَ صَاحِبُ الطَّعَامِ

title: It is recommended to take the stones out of dates, and it is recommended for the guest to pray for the host and to ask a righteous guest to supplicate, and he should respond to that request
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ وَضْعِ النَّوَى خَارِجَ التَّمْرِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ دُعَاءِ الضَّيْفِ لأَهْلِ الطَّعَامِ وَطَلَبِ الدُّعَاءِ مِنَ الضَّيْفِ الصَّالِحِ وَإِجَابَتِهِ لِذَلِكَ

title: Eating cucumbers with fresh dates
title_ar: باب أَكْلِ الْقِثَّاءِ بِالرُّطَبِ ‏‏

title: It is recommended to be humble when eating, and how to sit
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَوَاضُعِ الآكِلِ وَصِفَةِ قُعُودِهِ ‏‏

title: The prohibition of eating two dates etc., at a time when eating with a group, except with the permission of one's companions
title_ar: باب نَهْيِ الآكِلِ مَعَ جَمَاعَةٍ عَنْ قِرَانِ تَمْرَتَيْنِ وَنَحْوِهِمَا فِي لُقْمَةٍ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِ أَصْحَابِهِ

title: Storing dates and other provisions for one's children
title_ar: باب فِي ادْخَالِ التَّمْرِ وَنَحْوِهِ مِنَ الأَقْوَاتِ لِلْعِيَالِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of the dates of Al-Madinah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ تَمْرِ الْمَدِينَةِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of truffles, and treating the eyes with them
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْكَمْأَةِ وَمُدَاوَاةِ الْعَيْنِ بِهَا ‏‏

title: The virtue of the black fruit from the Arak tree
title_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ الأَسْوَدِ مِنَ الْكَبَاثِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of vinegar and using it as a condiment
title_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ الْخَلِّ وَالتَّأَدُّمِ بِهِ ‏‏

title: It is permissible to eat garlic, but the one who is going to address prominent people should refrain from eating it, and the same applies to other, similar foods
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ أَكْلِ الثُّومِ وَأَنَّهُ يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ أَرَادَ خِطَابِ الْكِبَارِ تَرْكُهُ وَكَذَا مَا فِي مَعْنَاهُ

title: Honoring guests and the virtue of showing preference to one's guest
title_ar: باب إِكْرَامِ الضَّيْفِ وَفَضْلِ إِيثَارِهِ ‏‏

title: The virtue of sharing a small amount of food, and the food of two is sufficient for three, and so on.
title_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ الْمُوَاسَاةِ فِي الطَّعَامِ الْقَلِيلِ وَأَنَّ طَعَامَ الاِثْنَيْنِ يَكْفِي الثَّلاَثَةَ وَنَحْوِ ذَلِكَ

title: The believer eats in one intestine and the disbeliever eats in seven intestines.
title_ar: باب الْمُؤْمِنُ يَأْكُلُ فِي مِعًى وَاحِدٍ وَالْكَافِرُ يَأْكُلُ فِي سَبْعَةِ أَمْعَاءٍ ‏‏

title: Do not criticize food
title_ar: باب لاَ يَعِيبُ الطَّعَامَ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Using Vessels Of Gold And Silver For Drinking Etc., For Men And Women
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ أَوَانِي الذَّهَبِ وَالْفِضَّةِ فِي الشُّرْبِ وَغَيْرِهِ عَلَى الرِّجَالِ وَالنِّسَاءِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Using Vessels Of Gold And Silver For Men And Women, And Gold Rings And Silk For Men, But They Are Permissible For Women. Permissibility Of Silken Borders On Garments For Men, But It Should Not Be More Than Four Fingers Wide
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ اسْتِعْمَالِ إِنَاءِ الذَّهَبِ وَالْفِضَّةِ عَلَى الرِّجَالِ وَالنِّسَاءِ وَخَاتَمِ الذَّهَبِ وَالْحَرِيرِ عَلَى الرَّجُلِ وَإِبَاحَتِهِ لِلنِّسَاءِ وَإِبَاحَةِ الْعَلَمِ وَنَحْوِهِ لِلرَّجُلِ مَا لَمْ يَزِدْ عَلَى أَرْبَعِ أَصَابِعَ

title: The Permissibility Of Wearing Silk For Men, If A Man Has A Skin Disease Or Similar Problem
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ لُبْسِ الْحَرِيرِ لِلرَّجُلِ إِذَا كَانَ بِهِ حِكَّةٌ أَوْ نَحْوُهَا ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of A Man Wearing A Garment Dyed With Safflower
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ لُبْسِ الرَّجُلِ الثَّوْبَ الْمُعَصْفَرَ، ‏‏

title: The Virtue Of Wearing The Hibarah
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ لِبَاسِ ثِيَابِ الْحِبَرَةِ ‏‏

title: Humility In Dress And Sticking To Coarse And Simple Clothes, Furnishings Etc., Permissibility Of Wearing Clothes Made From Camel Hair And Those On Which There Are Markings
title_ar: بَاب التَّوَاضُعِ فِي اللِّبَاسِ وَالِاقْتِصَارِ عَلَى الْغَلِيظِ مِنْهُ وَالْيَسِيرِ فِي اللِّبَاسِ وَالْفِرَاشِ وَغَيْرِهِمَا

title: The Permissibility Of Using Blankets
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ اتِّخَاذِ الأَنْمَاطِ ‏‏

title: It Is Disliked To Have More Furniture And Bedding Than One Needs
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ مَا زَادَ عَلَى الْحَاجَةِ مِنَ الْفِرَاشِ وَاللِّبَاسِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Letting One's Garment Drag Out Of Pride, And The Extent To Which It Is Permissible To Let It Hang Down And The Extent To Which It Is Recommended
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ جَرِّ الثَّوْبِ خُيَلاَءَ وَبَيَانِ حَدِّ مَا يَجُوزُ إِرْخَاؤُهُ إِلَيْهِ وَمَا يُسْتَحَبّ

title: The Prohibition Against Strutting With Pride, And Being Amazed With One's Clothes
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ التَّبَخْتُرِ فِي الْمَشْىِ مَعَ إِعْجَابِهِ بِثِيَابِهِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Gold Rings For Men, And Abrogation Of Their Allowance After The Beginning Of Islam
title_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ خَاتَمِ الذَّهَبِ عَلَى الرِّجَالِ وَنَسْخِ مَا كَانَ مِنْ إِبَاحَتِهِ فِي أَوَّلِ الْإِسْلَامِ

title: The Prophet (ﷺ) Wore A Ring Of Silver On Which Was Inscribed The Words Muhammad Rasul Allah (Muhammad the Messenger of Allah), And The Caliphs Wore It After He Died
title_ar: بَاب لُبْسِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ خَاتَمًا مِنْ وَرِقٍ نَقْشُهُ مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ وَلُبْسِ الْخُلَفَاءِ لَهُ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ

title: The Prophet (ﷺ) Acquired A Ring When He Wanted To Send Letters To The Non-Arabs
title_ar: باب فِي اتِّخَاذِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم خَاتَمًا لَمَّا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَكْتُبَ إِلَى الْعَجَمِ ‏‏

title: Discarding Rings
title_ar: باب فِي طَرْحِ الْخَوَاتِمِ ‏.‏

title: Silver Ring With An Abyssinian Stone
title_ar: باب فِي خَاتَمِ الْوَرِقِ فَصُّهُ حَبَشِيٌّ ‏.‏

title: Wearing Rings On The Little Finger
title_ar: باب فِي لُبْسِ الْخَاتَمِ فِي الْخِنْصَرِ مِنَ الْيَدِ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of Wearing Rings On The Middle Finger And The One That Is Next To It
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ التَّخَتُّمِ، فِي الْوُسْطَى وَالَّتِي تَلِيهَا ‏.‏

title: It Is Recommended To Wear Sandals et
title_ar: بَاب اسْتِحْبَابِ لُبْسِ النِّعَالِ وَمَا فِي مَعْنَاهَا

title: It Is Recommended To Put Shoes On The Right Foot First, And To Take Them Off From The Left Foot First, And It Is Disliked To Walk In One Shoe
title_ar: بَاب اسْتِحْبَابِ لُبْسِ النَّعْلِ فِي الْيُمْنَى أَوَّلًا وَالْخَلْعِ مِنْ الْيُسْرَى أَوَّلًا وَكَرَاهَةِ الْمَشْيِ فِي نَعْلٍ وَاحِدَةٍ

title: The Prohibition Of Ishtimal As-Samma' (Wrapping Oneself Up Entirely In One's Garment With No Room For The Arms To Emerge), And Al-Ihtiba' (Wrapping Oneself Up) In A Single Garment With The Legs Drawn Up To The Belly Exposing Part Of The 'Awrah
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ اشْتِمَالِ الصَّمَّاءِ، وَالاِحْتِبَاءِ، فِي ثَوْبٍ وَاحِدٍ ‏.‏

title: The Ruling On Lying On Ones Back With One Leg On Top Of The Other
title_ar: باب فِي مَنْعِ الاِسْتِلْقَاءِ عَلَى الظَّهْرِ وَوَضْعِ إِحْدَى الرِّجْلَيْنِ عَلَى الأُخْرَى ‏.‏

title: The Permissibility Of Lying Down And Placing One Leg On Top Of The Other
title_ar: باب فِي إِبَاحَةِ الاِسْتِلْقَاءِ وَوَضْعِ إِحْدَى الرِّجْلَيْنِ عَلَى الأُخْرَى ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of A Man Dyeing From With Saffron
title_ar: بَاب نَهْيِ الرَّجُلِ عَنْ التَّزَعْفُرِ

title: It Is Recommended To Dye White Hair With Yellow Or Red Dye, But Black Dye Is Haram
title_ar: بَاب اسْتِحْبَابِ خِضَابِ الشَّيْبِ بِصُفْرَةٍ أَوْ حُمْرَةٍ وَتَحْرِيمِهِ بِالسَّوَادِ

title: Differing From The Jews With Regard To Dyeing
title_ar: باب فِي مُخَالَفَةِ الْيَهُودِ فِي الصَّبْغِ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of Making Images Of Living Beings, And The Prohibition Of Using Images That Are Not Subjected To Disrespect In Furnishings And The Like; The Angels (Peace Be Upon Them) Do Not Enter A House In Which There Is An Image Or A Dog
title_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ تَصْوِيرِ صُورَةِ الْحَيَوَانِ وَتَحْرِيمِ اتِّخَاذِ مَا فِيهِ صُورَةٌ غَيْرُ مُمْتَهَنَةٍ بِالْفَرْشِ وَنَحْوِهِ

title: It Is Disliked To Take Dogs And Bells On A Journey
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْكَلْبِ وَالْجَرَسِ فِي السَّفَرِ ‏.‏

title: It Is Disliked To Hang Garlands On The Necks Of Camels
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ قِلاَدَةِ الْوَتَرِ فِي رَقَبَةِ الْبَعِيرِ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of Striking Or Branding Animals On The Face
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ ضَرْبِ الْحَيَوَانِ، فِي وَجْهِهِ وَوَسْمِهِ فِيهِ ‏.‏

title: The Permissibility Of Branding Animals Anywhere But On The Face, And This Is Recommended In The Case Of Animals Given As Zakat Ot Jizyah
title_ar: بَاب جَوَازِ وَسْمِ الْحَيَوَانِ غَيْرِ الْآدَمِيِّ فِي غَيْرِ الْوَجْهِ وَنَدْبِهِ فِي نَعَمْ الزَّكَاةِ وَالْجِزْيَةِ

title: It Is Disliked To Shave Part Of The Head And Leave Part
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْقَزَعِ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of Sitting In The Street; And Giving The Street Its Rights
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْجُلُوسِ، فِي الطُّرُقَاتِ وَإِعْطَاءِ الطَّرِيقِ حَقَّهُ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Adding Hair Extensions, Having Them Added, Tattooing, Being Tattooed, An-Namisah, Al-Mutanamisah, Separating Teeth, And Changing The Creation Of Allah
title_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ فِعْلِ الْوَاصِلَةِ وَالْمُسْتَوْصِلَةِ وَالْوَاشِمَةِ وَالْمُسْتَوْشِمَةِ وَالنَّامِصَةِ وَالْمُتَنَمِّصَةِ وَالْمُتَفَلِّجَاتِ وَالْمُغَيِّرَاتِ خَلْقِ اللَّهِ

title: Women Who Are Clothed Yet Naked, Turning Away From Righteousness And Leading Others Astray
title_ar: باب النِّسَاءِ الْكَاسِيَاتِ الْعَارِيَاتِ الْمَائِلاَتِ الْمُمِيلاَتِ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of Wearing A Garment Of Falsehood Etc., And Pretending To Have That Which Has Not Been Given To One
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ التَّزْوِيرِ، فِي اللِّبَاسِ وَغَيْرِهِ وَالتَّشَبُّعِ بِمَا لَمْ يُعْطَ ‏.‏

title: The Prohibition Of Taking The Kunyah Abul-Qasim, And The Names Which Are Recommended
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ التَّكَنِّي، بِأَبِي الْقَاسِمِ وَبَيَانِ مَا يُسْتَحَبُّ مِنَ الأَسْمَاءِ ‏.‏

title: It Is Disliked To Use Objectionable Names And Names Such As Nafi' (Beneficial) Etc
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ التَّسْمِيَةِ بِالأَسْمَاءِ الْقَبِيحَةِ وَبِنَافِعٍ وَنَحْوِهِ ‏.‏

title: It Is Recommended To Change Bad Names To Good Names, And To Change The Name Barrah To Zainab, Juwayriyah And The Like
title_ar: بَاب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَغْيِيرِ الِاسْمِ الْقَبِيحِ إِلَى حَسَنٍ وَتَغْيِيرِ اسْمِ بَرَّةَ إِلَى زَيْنَبَ وَجُوَيْرِيَةَ وَنَحْوِهِمَا

title: The Prohibition Of The Names Malik Al-Amlak Or Malik Al-Muluk "King Of Kings"
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ التَّسَمِّي بِمَلِكِ الأَمْلاَكِ وَبِمَلِكِ الْمُلُوكِ ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended To Perform Tahnik For The Newborn When He Is Born And To Take Him To A Righteous Man To Perform Tahnik For Him; It Is Permissible To Name Him On The Day He Is Born, And It Is Recommended To Use The Names 'Abdullah, Ibrahim, And The Names Of All Other Prophets, Peace Be Upon Them
title_ar: بَاب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَحْنِيكِ الْمَوْلُودِ عِنْدَ وِلَادَتِهِ وَحَمْلِهِ إِلَى صَالِحٍ يُحَنِّكُهُ وَجَوَازِ تَسْمِيَتِهِ يَوْمَ وِلَادَتِهِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ التَّسْمِيَةِ بِعَبْدِ اللَّهِ وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ وَسَائِرِ أَسْمَاءِ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ عَلَيْهِمْ السَّلَام

title: It Is Permissible To Say: "O My Son" To Someone Other Than One's Son, And It Is Recommended To Speak Kindly
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ قَوْلِهِ لِغَيْرِ ابْنِهِ يَا بُنَىَّ وَاسْتِحْبَابِهِ لِلْمُلاَطَفَةِ ‏‏

title: Seeking Permission To Enter A House
title_ar: باب الاِسْتِئْذَانِ ‏‏

title: It Is Disliked For The Person Who Is Seeking Permission To Say "Me" When Asked "Who Is It?"
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ قَوْلِ الْمُسْتَأْذِنِ أَنَا ‏إِذَا قِيلَ مَنْ هَذَا ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Looking Into A House
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ النَّظَرِ فِي بَيْتِ غَيْرِهِ ‏‏

title: An Accidental Glance
title_ar: باب نَظَرِ الْفَجْأَةِ ‏‏

title: The One Who Is Riding Should Greet The One Who Is Walking, And The Smaller Group Should Greet The Larger Group
title_ar: باب يُسَلِّمُ الرَّاكِبُ عَلَى الْمَاشِي وَالْقَلِيلُ عَلَى الْكَثِيرِ ‏‏

title: One Of The Duties Of Sitting In The Street Is To Return Salam
title_ar: باب مِنْ حَقِّ الْجُلُوسِ عَلَى الطَّرِيقِ رَدُّ السَّلاَمِ ‏‏

title: One Of The Rights Of One Muslim Over Another Is (The Greeting Of) Salam
title_ar: باب مِنْ حَقِّ الْمُسْلِمِ لِلْمُسْلِمِ رَدُّ السَّلاَمِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Initiating The Greeting With The People Of The Book, And How To Respond To Them
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ ابْتِدَاءِ، أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ بِالسَّلاَمِ وَكَيْفَ يَرُدُّ عَلَيْهِمْ ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended To Greet Children With Salam
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ السَّلاَمِ عَلَى الصِّبْيَانِ ‏‏

title: It Is Permissible To Give Permission To Enter By Raising The Curtain Or Giving Some Other Sign
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ جَعْلِ الإِذْنِ رَفْعَ حِجَابٍ أَوْ نَحْوَهُ مِنَ الْعَلاَمَاتِ ‏‏

title: The Permissibility Of Women Going Out To Relieve Themselves
title_ar: باب إِبَاحَةُ الْخُرُوجِ لِلنِّسَاءِ لِقَضَاءِ حَاجَةِ الإِنْسَانِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Being Alone With A Non-Mahram Woman Or Entering Upon Her
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْخَلْوَةِ بِالأَجْنَبِيَّةِ وَالدُّخُولِ عَلَيْهَا ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended For The One Who Is Seen Alone With A Woman Who Is His Wife Or Mahram, To Say; "This Is So-And-So,' To Ward off Suspicion
title_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّهُ يُسْتَحَبُّ لِمَنْ رُئِيَ خَالِيًا بِامْرَأَةٍ وَكَانَتْ زَوْجَةً أَوْ مَحْرَمًا لَهُ

title: If A Man Comes To A Gathering And Finds A Space. Let Him Sit There, Otherwise Let Him Sit Behind Them
title_ar: باب مَنْ أَتَى مَجْلِسًا فَوَجَدَ فُرْجَةً فَجَلَسَ فِيهَا وَإِلاَّ وَرَاءَهُمْ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Making A Man Get Up From A Place That He Reached First
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ إِقَامَةِ الإِنْسَانِ مِنْ مَوْضِعِهِ الْمُبَاحِ الَّذِي سَبَقَ إِلَيْهِ ‏‏

title: If A Man Gets Up From His Spot Then Comes Back To It, He Has More Right To It
title_ar: باب إِذَا قَامَ مِنْ مَجْلِسِهِ ثُمَّ عَادَ فَهُوَ أَحَقُّ بِهِ ‏‏

title: Forbidding A Hermaphrodite From Entering Upon Non-Mahram Women
title_ar: باب مَنْعِ الْمُخَنَّثِ مِنَ الدُّخُولِ عَلَى النِّسَاءِ الأَجَانِبِ ‏‏

title: It Is Permissible To Seat A Non-Mahram Woman Behind One (On A Mount) If She Is Exhausted On The Road
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ إِرْدَافِ الْمَرْأَةِ الأَجْنَبِيَّةِ إِذَا أَعْيَتْ فِي الطَّرِيقِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Two People Conversing Privately To The Exclusion Of A Third Without His Consent
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ مُنَاجَاةِ الاِثْنَيْنِ دُونَ الثَّالِثِ بِغَيْرِ رِضَاهُ ‏‏

title: Medicine, Sickness And Ruqyah
title_ar: باب الطِّبِّ وَالْمَرَضِ وَالرُّقَى ‏‏

title: Witchcraft
title_ar: باب السِّحْرِ ‏‏

title: Poison
title_ar: باب السَّمِّ ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended To Recite Ruqyah For One Who Is Sick
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ رُقْيَةِ الْمَرِيضِ ‏‏

title: Reciting Al-Mu'awwidhat As Ruqyah For The Sick, And Blowing Over Them
title_ar: باب رُقْيَةِ الْمَرِيضِ بِالْمُعَوِّذَاتِ وَالنَّفْثِ ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended To Recite Ruqyah For The Evil Eye, Pustules, And Stings
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الرُّقْيَةِ مِنَ الْعَيْنِ وَالنَّمْلَةِ وَالْحُمَةِ وَالنَّظْرَةِ ‏‏

title: There Is Nothing Wrong With Ruqyah That Does Not Involve Shirk
title_ar: باب لاَ بَأْسَ بِالرُّقَى مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ فِيهِ شِرْكٌ ‏‏

title: The Permissibility Of Accepting A Reward For Reciting Ruqyah With Qur'an And Supplications
title_ar: باب جَوَازِ أَخْذِ الأُجْرَةِ عَلَى الرُّقْيَةِ بِالْقُرْآنِ وَالأَذْكَارِ ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended To Put Ones Hand On The Site Of The Pain When Supplicating
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ وَضْعِ يَدِهِ عَلَى مَوْضِعِ الأَلَمِ مَعَ الدُّعَاءِ ‏‏

title: Seeking Refuge With Allah From The Devil Who Whispers During Prayer
title_ar: باب التَّعَوُّذِ مِنْ شَيْطَانِ الْوَسْوَسَةِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ ‏‏

title: For Every Disease There Is A Remedy, And It Is Recommended To Treat Disease
title_ar: باب لِكُلِّ دَاءٍ دَوَاءٌ وَاسْتِحْبَابُ التَّدَاوِي ‏‏

title: It Is Disliked To Administer Medicine In The Side Of The Mouth Forcibly
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ التَّدَاوِي بِاللَّدُودِ ‏‏

title: Treatment With Indian Aloeswood, Which Is Costmary
title_ar: باب التَّدَاوِي بِالْعُودِ الْهِنْدِيِّ وَهُوَ الْكُسْتُ ‏‏

title: Healing Sickness With The Black Seed
title_ar: باب التَّدَاوِي بِالْحَبَّةِ السَّوْدَاءِ ‏‏

title: Talbinah Gives Comfort To The Sick Person
title_ar: باب التَّلْبِينَةُ مَجَمَّةٌ لِفُؤَادِ الْمَرِيضِ ‏‏

title: Treating Sickness With A Drink Of Honey
title_ar: باب التَّدَاوِي بِسَقْىِ الْعَسَلِ ‏‏

title: The Plague, Ill Omens, Soothsaying And The Like
title_ar: باب الطَّاعُونِ وَالطِّيَرَةِ وَالْكَهَانَةِ وَنَحْوِهَا ‏‏

title: There Is No 'Adwa, No Tiyarah (Evil Omens), No Hamah. No Safar, No Nawa', And No Ghoul, And No Sick Camel Should Be Brought To A Healthy Camel
title_ar: باب لاَ عَدْوَى وَلاَ طِيَرَةَ وَلاَ هَامَةَ وَلاَ صَفَرَ

title: (Evil) Omens And Al-Fa'l, And That Which May Be Regarded As Inauspicious
title_ar: باب الطِّيَرَةِ وَالْفَأْلِ وَمَا يَكُونُ فِيهِ الشُّؤْمُ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Soothsaying And Going To Soothsayers
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْكِهَانَةِ وَإِتْيَانِ الْكُهَّانِ ‏‏

title: Avoiding Lepers Etc.
title_ar: باب اجْتِنَابِ الْمَجْذُومِ وَنَحْوِهِ ‏‏

title: Killing Snakes Etc.
title_ar: باب قَتْلِ الْحَيَّاتِ وَغَيْرِهَا ‏‏

title: It Is Recommended To Kill Geckos
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ قَتْلِ الْوَزَغِ ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Killing Ants
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ قَتْلِ النَّمْلِ، ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Killing Cats
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ قَتْلِ الْهِرَّةِ ‏‏

title: The Virtue Of Giving Food And Water To Animals Which Are Unlawful To Eat
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ سَاقِي الْبَهَائِمِ الْمُحْتَرَمَةِ وَإِطْعَامِهَا ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Cursing Time
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ سَبِّ الدَّهْرِ، ‏‏

title: It Is Disliked To Call Grapes Karm
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ تَسْمِيَةِ الْعِنَبِ كَرْمًا ‏‏

title: Ruling On Using The Words 'Abd And Amah (For Slaves) And Mawla And Sayyid (For Masters)
title_ar: باب حُكْمِ إِطْلاَقِ لَفْظَةِ الْعَبْدِ وَالأَمَةِ وَالْمَوْلَى وَالسَّيِّدِ ‏‏

title: It Is Disliked For A Man To Say: "Khabuthat Nafsi" (I Feel Bad)
title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ قَوْلِ الإِنْسَانِ خَبُثَتْ نَفْسِي ‏‏

title: Using Musk, Which Is The Best Of Perfume. It Is Disliked To Refuse A Gift Of Scent Or Perfume
title_ar: باب اسْتِعْمَالِ الْمِسْكِ وَأَنَّهُ أَطْيَبُ الطِّيبِ وَكَرَاهَةِ رَدِّ الرَّيْحَانِ وَالطِّيبِ ‏‏
باب ‏‏

title: The Prohibition Of Playing Nardashir
title_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ اللَّعِبِ بِالنَّرْدَشِيرِ ‏‏
باب ‏‏

title: The Words Of The Prophet (ﷺ): "Whoever Sees Me In A Dream Has Indeed Seen Me."
title_ar: باب قَوْلِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏"‏ مَنْ رَآنِي فِي الْمَنَامِ فَقَدْ رَآنِي ‏"‏ ‏‏

title: No One Should Speak Of How The Shaitan Toyed With Him In His Sleep
title_ar: باب لاَ يُخْبِرُ بِتَلَعُّبِ الشَّيْطَانِ بِهِ فِي الْمَنَامِ ‏‏

title: Interpretation Of Dreams
title_ar: باب فِي تَأْوِيلِ الرُّؤْيَا ‏‏

title: The Dreams Of The Prophet (ﷺ)

title_ar: باب الْعَزْمِ بِالدُّعَاءِ وَلاَ يَقُلْ إِنْ شِئْتَ

title_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ تَمَنِّي الْمَوْتِ لِضُرٍّ نَزَلَ بِهِ

title: The Virtue Of Remembrance, Supplication, Drawing Close To Allah And Thinking Positively Of Him

title: It Is Disliked To Pray For Punishment To Be Brought Forward In This World

title: The Virtues Of Gathering To Remember Allah (Adh-Dhikr)
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ مَجَالِسِ الذِّكْرِ

title: The Virtue Of Tahlil (Saying La Ilaha Ill-Allah), Tasbih (Saying Subhan Allah) And (Du'a) Supplication

title_ar: باب فَضْلِ الاِجْتِمَاعِ عَلَى تِلاَوَةِ الْقُرْآنِ وَعَلَى الذِّكْرِ

title: It Is Recommend To Pray For Forgiveness A Great Deal

title: It Is Recommend To Lower One's Voice When Saying Remembrance, Except In The Cases Where It Is Commanded To Raise The Voice Such As The Talbiyah Etc. It Is Recommend To Say A Great Deal, "There Is No Power And No Strength Except With Allah"
title_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ خَفْضِ الصَّوْتِ بِالذِّكْرِ

title: Supplications And Seeking Refuge With Allah
title_ar: باب التَّعَوُّذِ مِنْ شَرِّ الْفِتَنِ وَغَيْرِهَا

title: Seeking Refuge With Allah From Helplessness, Laziness Etc

title_ar: باب دُعَاءِ الْكَرْبِ

title: The Virtue Of (Saying): "Glory To Allah And With His Praise"

باب ‏‏
باب ‏‏

title: The Smoke (Ad-Dukhan)
title_ar: باب الدُّخَانِ ‏‏

title_ar: باب انْشِقَاقِ الْقَمَرِ ‏‏

title: The Likeness Of The Believer Is That Of A Date Palm
title_ar: باب مَثَلُ الْمُؤْمِنِ مَثَلُ النَّخْلَةِ ‏‏

title: No One Will Enter Paradise By Virtue Of His Deeds, Rather By The Mercy Of Allah, Exalted Is He
title_ar: باب لَنْ يَدْخُلَ أَحَدٌ الْجَنَّةَ بِعَمَلِهِ بَلْ بِرَحْمَةِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ‏‏

title: Doing A Lot Of Good Deeds And Striving Hard In Worship
title_ar: باب إِكْثَارِ الأَعْمَالِ وَالاِجْتِهَادِ فِي الْعِبَادَةِ ‏‏

title: Moderation In Preaching
title_ar: باب الاِقْتِصَادِ فِي الْمَوْعِظَةِ ‏‏
باب ‏‏

title: In Paradise There Is A Tree In Whose Shade A Rider Could Travel For One Hundred Years And Still Not Cross It
title_ar: باب إِنَّ فِي الْجَنَّةِ شَجَرَةً يَسِيرُ الرَّاكِبُ فِي ظِلِّهَا مِائَةَ عَامٍ لاَ يَقْطَعُهَا ‏‏

title: Bestowal Of Divine Pleasure On The People Of Paradise, And Allah Will Never Be Angry With Them
title_ar: باب إِحْلاَلِ الرِّضْوَانِ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ فَلاَ يَسْخَطُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَبَدًا ‏‏

title: The Market Of Paradise, And What They Will Get There Of Delight And Beauty
title_ar: باب فِي سُوقِ الْجَنَّةِ وَمَا يَنَالُونَ فِيهَا مِنَ النَّعِيمِ وَالْجَمَالِ ‏‏

title: The First Group To Enter Paradise Will Look Like The Moon When It Is Full; Their Attributes And Their Spouses
title_ar: بَاب أَوَّلُ زُمْرَةٍ تَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ عَلَى صُورَةِ الْقَمَرِ لَيْلَةَ الْبَدْرِ وَصِفَاتُهُمْ وَأَزْوَاجُهُمْ

title: The Attributes Of Paradise And Its People, And Their Glorifying Allah Every Morning And Evening
title_ar: باب فِي صِفَاتِ الْجَنَّةِ وَأَهْلِهَا وَتَسْبِيحِهِمْ فِيهَا بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا ‏‏

title: The Eternal Delight Of The People Of Paradise, And The Verse In Which Allah Says: "And It Will Be Announced To Them: This Is The Paradise Which You Have Inherited For What You Used To Do"

title: The Tents Of Paradise, And The Wives That The Believers Will Have In Them
title_ar: باب فِي صِفَةِ خِيَامِ الْجَنَّةِ وَمَا لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ فِيهَا مِنَ الأَهْلِينَ

title: Rivers Of Paradise In This World
title_ar: باب مَا فِي الدُّنْيَا مِنْ أَنْهَارِ الْجَنَّةِ

title: People Will Enter Paradise Whose Hearts Are Like The Hearts Of Birds
title_ar: باب يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ أَقْوَامٌ أَفْئِدَتُهُمْ مِثْلُ أَفْئِدَةِ الطَّيْرِ

title: About Hell - May Allah Protect Us From It
title_ar: باب فِي شِدَّةِ حَرِّ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ وَبُعْدِ قَعْرِهَا وَمَا تَأْخُذُ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ

title: The Arrogant Will Enter The Fire, And The Humble Will Enter Paradise

title: The Passing Away Of This World, And The Gathering On The Day Of Resurrection
title_ar: باب فَنَاءِ الدُّنْيَا وَبَيَانِ الْحَشْرِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

title: The Description Of The Day Of Resurrection - May Allah Save Us From Its Terrors
title_ar: باب فِي صِفَةِ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ أَعَانَنَا اللَّهُ عَلَى أَهْوَالِهَا

title: Attributes By Which The People Of Paradise And The People Of The Fire May Be Recognized In This World

title: The Deceased Is Shown His Place In Paradise Or The Fire; And Confirmation Of The Torment In The Grave - We Seek Refuge With Allah From That
title_ar: بَاب عَرْضِ مَقْعَدِ الْمَيِّتِ مِنْ الْجَنَّةِ أَوْ النَّارِ عَلَيْهِ وَإِثْبَاتِ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَالتَّعَوُّذِ مِنْهُ

title: The Surety Of Reckoning

title_ar: بَابُ شَرِكَةِ عِنَانٍ بَيْنَ ثَلاَثَةٍ
intro_en: This is a partnership between so and so, and so and so, and so and so, who are in good health, and in full control of their wealth, having formed a partnership with thirty thousand Dirhams, non-counterfeit and weighing seven, each one of them contributing ten thousand Dirhams which they have put together and combined, so that thev are now held in common between them on the basis of three equal shares, on the condition that they will work on the basis of fear of Allah and of honesty, each one of them fulfilling the trust toward each of the others. They will all buy whatever they see fit with it, cash or credit, whatever they see fit of different goods. Each one of them may buy on his own without consulting his companions, whatever he sees fit to buy with cash, he may do so, and whatever he sees fit to buy on credit, he may do so. They may work together, or each may work independently of his partners as he sees fit. All of that is binding on them individually, and on the two others, with regard to decisions taken collectively, or individually. Whatever commitment any of them makes, whether small or great, it is binding on each of the other partners, and is binding on all of them. All bounty and profits that Allah bestows over the capital amount, which is stated in this contract, is to be divided into three equal parts. Any loss is to be borne by all three partners proportionate to their capital investment. Three identical copies of this document have been made, and one given to each of the three partners. Signed by so and so, so and so and so and so.

title: A Proxy Partnership Between Four Persons According To Those Who Permit It
intro: قَالَ اللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَتَعَالَى: {يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَوْفُوا بِالْعُقُودِ} هَذَا مَا اشْتَرَكَ عَلَيْهِ فُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ بَيْنَهُمْ شَرِكَةَ مُفَاوَضَةٍ فِي رَأْسِ مَالٍ جَمَعُوهُ بَيْنَهُمْ مِنْ صِنْفٍ وَاحِدٍ وَنَقْدٍ وَاحِدٍ وَخَلَطُوهُ وَصَارَ فِي أَيْدِيهِمْ مُمْتَزِجًا لاَ يُعْرَفُ بَعْضُهُ مِنْ بَعْضٍ وَمَالُ كُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ فِي ذَلِكَ وَحَقُّهُ سَوَاءٌ عَلَى أَنْ يَعْمَلُوا فِي ذَلِكَ كُلِّهِ وَفِي كُلِّ قَلِيلٍ وَكَثِيرٍ سَوَاءً مِنَ الْمُبَايَعَاتِ وَالْمُتَاجَرَاتِ نَقْدًا وَنَسِيئَةً بَيْعًا وَشِرَاءً فِي جَمِيعِ الْمُعَامَلاَتِ وَفِي كُلِّ مَا يَتَعَاطَاهُ النَّاسُ بَيْنَهُمْ مُجْتَمِعِينَ بِمَا رَأَوْا وَيَعْمَلَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ عَلَى انْفِرَادِهِ بِكُلِّ مَا رَأَى وَكُلِّ مَا بَدَا لَهُ جَائِزٌ أَمْرُهُ فِي ذَلِكَ عَلَى كُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ وَعَلَى أَنَّهُ كُلُّ مَا لَزِمَ كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ عَلَى هَذِهِ الشَّرِكَةِ الْمَوْصُوفَةِ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ مِنْ حَقٍّ وَمِنْ دَيْنٍ فَهُوَ لاَزِمٌ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ الْمُسَمِّينَ مَعَهُ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ وَعَلَى أَنَّ جَمِيعَ مَا رَزَقَهُمُ اللَّهُ فِي هَذِهِ الشَّرِكَةِ الْمُسَمَّاةِ فِيهِ وَمَا رَزَقَ اللَّهُ كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ فِيهَا عَلَى حِدَتِهِ مِنْ فَضْلٍ وَرِبْحٍ فَهُوَ بَيْنَهُمْ جَمِيعًا بِالسَّوِيَّةِ وَمَا كَانَ فِيهَا مِنْ نَقِيصَةٍ فَهُوَ عَلَيْهِمْ جَمِيعًا بِالسَّوِيَّةِ بَيْنَهُمْ وَقَدْ جَعَلَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْ فُلاَنٍ وَفُلاَنٍ وَفُلاَنٍ وَفُلاَنٍ كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ الْمُسَمِّينَ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ مَعَهُ وَكِيلَهُ فِي الْمُطَالَبَةِ بِكُلِّ حَقٍّ هُوَ لَهُ وَالْمُخَاصَمَةِ فِيهِ وَقَبْضِهِ وَفِي خُصُومَةِ كُلِّ مَنِ اعْتَرَضَهُ بِخُصُومَةٍ وَكُلِّ مَنْ يُطَالِبُهُ بِحَقٍّ وَجَعَلَهُ وَصِيَّهُ فِي شَرِكَتِهِ مِنْ بَعْدِ وَفَاتِهِ وَفِي قَضَاءِ دُيُونِهِ وَإِنْفَاذِ وَصَايَاهُ وَقَبِلَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ كُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ مَا جَعَلَ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ ذَلِكَ كُلِّهِ أَقَرَّ فُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ.
title_ar: بَابُ شَرِكَةِ مُفَاوَضَةٍ بَيْنَ أَرْبَعَةٍ عَلَى مَذْهَبِ مَنْ يُجِيزُهَا
intro_en: Allah says: 0 you who believe! Fulfill (your) obligations [Al-Ma'idah:1]. This is a partnership formed between so and so, so and so, so and so and so and so, based on capital which they have collected of one type, and currency, and have combined it, so that it is now mixed, and none of them can tell which is his money. The share and rights of each partner are equal, and they will use this money for trade, whether buying or selling, for cash, or on credit, in all transactions, making decisions collectively or individually, each working independently of the others based on his own opinion, and what he sees fit. Whatever commitment or loan any one of the persons mentioned in this contract makes, then it is binding on each of his companions mentioned in this contract. All bounty and profits that Allah bestows over the capital amount, which is stated in this contract, is to be divided equally between all four. Any loss is to be borne equally by each of them. Each of the four persons mentioned in this contract appoints the others as his deputy (Wakil) who may demand every right, and debt, and deal with every dispute, concerning this contract, to dispute on behalf of the others with anyone who is disputing with them, or seek their dues. And each of them makes the others his executor (to act on his behalf after he dies), pay off his debts, and carry out the instructions in his will. Signed by so and so, so and so, so and so and so and so.

title: Labor Partnership (Abdan)
title_ar: باب شَرِكَةِ الأَبْدَانِ

title: Partners Dissolving A Partnership
intro: هَذَا كِتَابٌ كَتَبَهُ فُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَقَرَّ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ الْمُسَمِّينَ مَعَهُ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ بِجَمِيعِ مَا فِيهِ فِي صِحَّةٍ مِنْهُ وَجَوَازِ أَمْرٍ أَنَّهُ جَرَتْ بَيْنَنَا مُعَامَلاَتٌ وَمُتَاجَرَاتٌ وَأَشْرِيَةٌ وَبُيُوعٌ وَخُلْطَةٌ وَشَرِكَةٌ فِي أَمْوَالٍ وَفِي أَنْوَاعٍ مِنَ الْمُعَامَلاَتِ وَقُرُوضٌ وَمُصَارَفَاتٌ وَوَدَائِعُ وَأَمَانَاتٌ وَسَفَاتِجُ وَمُضَارَبَاتٌ وَعَوَارِي وَدُيُونٌ وَمُؤَاجَرَاتٌ وَمُزَارَعَاتٌ وَمُؤَاكَرَاتٌ وَإِنَّا تَنَاقَضْنَا عَلَى التَّرَاضِي مِنَّا جَمِيعًا بِمَا فَعَلْنَا جَمِيعَ مَا كَانَ بَيْنَنَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَرِكَةٍ وَمِنْ كُلِّ مُخَالَطَةٍ كَانَتْ جَرَتْ بَيْنَنَا فِي نَوْعٍ مِنَ الأَمْوَالِ وَالْمُعَامَلاَتِ وَفَسَخْنَا ذَلِكَ كُلَّهُ فِي جَمِيعِ مَا جَرَى بَيْنَنَا فِي جَمِيعِ الأَنْوَاعِ وَالأَصْنَافِ وَبَيَّنَّا ذَلِكَ كُلَّهُ نَوْعًا نَوْعًا وَعَلِمْنَا مَبْلَغَهُ وَمُنْتَهَاهُ وَعَرَفْنَاهُ عَلَى حَقِّهِ وَصِدْقِهِ فَاسْتَوْفَى كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا جَمِيعَ حَقِّهِ مِنْ ذَلِكَ أَجْمَعَ وَصَارَ فِي يَدِهِ فَلَمْ يَبْقَ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا قِبَلَ كُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ الْمُسَمِّينَ مَعَهُ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ وَلاَ قِبَلَ أَحَدٍ بِسَبَبِهِ وَلاَ بِاسْمِهِ حَقٌّ وَلاَ دَعْوَى وَلاَ طَلِبَةٌ لأَنَّ كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا قَدِ اسْتَوْفَى جَمِيعَ حَقِّهِ وَجَمِيعَ مَا كَانَ لَهُ مِنْ جَمِيعِ ذَلِكَ كُلِّهِ وَصَارَ فِي يَدِهِ مُوَفَّرًا أَقَرَّ فُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ.
title_ar: بَابُ تَفَرُّقِ الشُّرَكَاءِ عَنْ شَرِيكِهِمْ
intro_en: This is a contract drawn up by so and so, so and so, so and so and so and so, and signed by each one of them, and each of his companions mentioned alongside him in this contract, who are in good health, and in full control of their wealth. There has taken place among us, dealing and trading, buying and selling, sharing of wealth and different types of dealing, loans, trusts, partnerships, debts, leases and sharecropping. We are dissolving the partnership by mutual consent and are content with all that we did. All that was between us of partnership and dealing has to do with money and wealth and we have settled all of that in all types of dealings. We have explained all of that in every category. Each one of us has taken all his dues, and it is now in his possession. None of those named in this contract owes anything to any of the others, nor to anyone else connected to the others, because each one of us has taken all his dues, and it has come into his possession. Signed by So-and-so, So-and-so, so and so and so and so.

title: Separation Of The Married Couple
intro: قَالَ اللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَتَعَالَى: {وَلاَ يَحِلُّ لَكُمْ أَنْ تَأْخُذُوا مِمَّا آتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ شَيْئًا إِلاَّ أَنْ يَخَافَا أَلاَّ يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ اللَّهِ فَإِنْ خِفْتُمْ أَلاَّ يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ اللَّهِ فَلاَ جُنَاحَ عَلَيْهِمَا فِيمَا افْتَدَتْ بِهِ} هَذَا كِتَابٌ كَتَبَتْهُ فُلاَنَةُ بِنْتُ فُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنٍ فِي صِحَّةٍ مِنْهَا وَجَوَازِ أَمْرٍ لِفُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنٍ إِنِّي كُنْتُ زَوْجَةً لَكَ وَكُنْتَ دَخَلْتَ بِي فَأَفْضَيْتَ إِلَيَّ ثُمَّ إِنِّي كَرِهْتُ صُحْبَتَكَ وَأَحْبَبْتُ مُفَارَقَتَكَ عَنْ غَيْرِ إِضْرَارٍ مِنْكَ بِي وَلاَ مَنْعِي لِحَقٍّ وَاجِبٍ لِي عَلَيْكَ وَإِنِّي سَأَلْتُكَ عِنْدَمَا خِفْنَا أَنْ لاَ نُقِيمَ حُدُودَ اللَّهِ أَنْ تَخْلَعَنِي فَتُبِينَنِي مِنْكَ بِتَطْلِيقَةٍ بِجَمِيعِ مَالِي عَلَيْكَ مِنْ صَدَاقٍ وَهُوَ كَذَا وَكَذَا دِينَارًا جِيَادًا مَثَاقِيلَ وَبِكَذَا وَكَذَا دِينَارًا جِيَادًا مَثَاقِيلَ أَعْطَيْتُكَهَا عَلَى ذَلِكَ سِوَى مَا فِي صَدَاقِي فَفَعَلْتَ الَّذِي سَأَلْتُكَ مِنْهُ فَطَلَّقْتَنِي تَطْلِيقَةً بَائِنَةً بِجَمِيعِ مَا كَانَ بَقِيَ لِي عَلَيْكَ مِنْ صَدَاقِي الْمُسَمَّى مَبْلَغُهُ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ وَبِالدَّنَانِيرِ الْمُسَمَّاةِ فِيهِ سِوَى ذَلِكَ فَقَبِلْتُ ذَلِكَ مِنْكَ مُشَافَهَةً لَكَ عِنْدَ مُخَاطَبَتِكَ إِيَّايَ بِهِ وَمُجَاوَبَةً عَلَى قَوْلِكَ مِنْ قَبْلِ تَصَادُرِنَا عَنْ مَنْطِقِنَا ذَلِكَ وَدَفَعْتُ إِلَيْكَ جَمِيعَ هَذِهِ الدَّنَانِيرِ الْمُسَمَّى مَبْلَغُهَا فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ الَّذِي خَالَعْتَنِي عَلَيْهَا وَافِيَةً سِوَى مَا فِي صَدَاقِي فَصِرْتُ بَائِنَةً مِنْكَ مَالِكَةً لأَمْرِي بِهَذَا الْخُلْعِ الْمَوْصُوفِ أَمْرُهُ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ فَلاَ سَبِيلَ لَكَ عَلَيَّ وَلاَ مُطَالَبَةَ وَلاَ رَجْعَةَ وَقَدْ قَبَضْتُ مِنْكَ جَمِيعَ مَا يَجِبُ لِمِثْلِي مَا دُمْتُ فِي عِدَّةٍ مِنْكَ وَجَمِيعَ مَا أَحْتَاجُ إِلَيْهِ بِتَمَامِ مَا يَجِبُ لِلْمُطَلَّقَةِ الَّتِي تَكُونُ فِي مِثْلِ حَالِي عَلَى زَوْجِهَا الَّذِي يَكُونُ فِي مِثْلِ حَالِكَ فَلَمْ يَبْقَ لِوَاحِدٍ مِنَّا قِبَلَ صَاحِبِهِ حَقٌّ وَلاَ دَعْوَى وَلاَ طَلِبَةٌ فَكُلُّ مَا ادَّعَى وَاحِدٌ مِنَّا قِبَلَ صَاحِبِهِ مِنْ حَقٍّ وَمِنْ دَعْوَى وَمِنْ طَلِبَةٍ بِوَجْهٍ مِنَ الْوُجُوهِ فَهُوَ فِي جَمِيعِ دَعْوَاهُ مُبْطِلٌ وَصَاحِبُهُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ أَجْمَعَ بَرِيءٌ وَقَدْ قَبِلَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا كُلَّ مَا أَقَرَّ لَهُ بِهِ صَاحِبُهُ وَكُلَّ مَا أَبْرَأَهُ مِنْهُ مِمَّا وُصِفَ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ مُشَافَهَةً عِنْدَ مُخَاطَبَتِهِ إِيَّاهُ قَبْلَ تَصَادُرِنَا عَنْ مَنْطِقِنَا وَافْتِرَاقِنَا عَنْ مَجْلِسِنَا الَّذِي جَرَى بَيْنَنَا فِيهِ أَقَرَّتْ فُلاَنَةُ وَفُلاَنٌ.
title_ar: بَابُ تَفَرُّقِ الزَّوْجَيْنِ عَنْ مُزَاوَجَتِهِمَا
intro_en:
Allah, Blessed and Most High, says: And it is not lawful for you (men) to take back (from your wives) any of your (bridal-money) which you have given them, except when both parties fear that they would be unable to keep the limits ordained by Allah. Then if you fear that they would not be able to keep the limits ordained by Allah, then there is no sin on either of them for what they give back [Al-Baqarah:229]
This writ was written by so and so, the daughter of so and so, who is in good health and in full control of her wealth, to so and so the son of so and so the son of so and so. I was a wife to you, and you came in to me, and consummated the marriage with me. Then I did not like your company, and I wanted to leave you, without your having done any harm to me, nor having withheld any of my rights. I asked you, when we feared that we would not be able to keep the limits ordained by Allah, to free me (Khul') and to divorce me irrevocably in return for all my Sadaq (Mahr) that is due from you to me, which is such-and-such a number of Dirhams, non-counterfeit, and such-and-such a number of Dinars, non-counterfeit, that I gave you in addition to that, apart from my Sadaq. You did what I asked of you, and you gave me an irrevocable divorce in return for what was left of my Sadaq, as stated in this writ, and in return for the additional Dinars stated. I accepted that from you verbally when we were talking about it, and in response to what you said before we finished our discussion, and departed. I gave you all the Dinars mentioned in this contract in return for which you granted me Khul, except for my Sadaq. Thus I became irrevocably divorced from you, and now I am in control of my own affairs, based on this Khul' which is described in this contract. Thus you have no control over me, you cannot make demands of me, and you cannot take me back. I have taken from you all that is due to a woman like me at the time of 'Iddah, and I took all that I need in full, which a woman like me would take from a husband like you. Neither of us has any further rights, nor claims over the other. If any one of use makes any claim on the other, this claim is totally and utterly false, and the one against whom the claim is made is innocent, and has nothing to do with this claim. Each one of us accepts everything that the other party offers, and all that the other party relieves him of, as described in the contract, verbally when we were talking about it, and before we spoke of anything, or parted from our meeting that took place. Signed by so and so (the wife) and so and so (the husband).

title: Contract Of Manumission
intro: قَالَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ: {وَالَّذِينَ يَبْتَغُونَ الْكِتَابَ مِمَّا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ فَكَاتِبُوهُمْ إِنْ عَلِمْتُمْ فِيهِمْ خَيْرًا} هَذَا كِتَابٌ كَتَبَهُ فُلاَنُ بْنُ فُلاَنٍ فِي صِحَّةٍ مِنْهُ وَجَوَازِ أَمْرٍ لِفَتَاهُ النُّوبِيِّ الَّذِي يُسَمَّى فُلاَنًا وَهُوَ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي مِلْكِهِ وَيَدِهِ إِنِّي كَاتَبْتُكَ عَلَى ثَلاَثَةِ آلاَفِ دِرْهَمٍ وُضْحٍ جِيَادٍ وَزْنِ سَبْعَةٍ مُنَجَّمَةٍ عَلَيْكَ سِتُّ سِنِينَ مُتَوَالِيَاتٍ أَوَّلُهَا مُسْتَهَلَّ شَهْرِ كَذَا مِنْ سَنَةِ كَذَا عَلَى أَنْ تَدْفَعَ إِلَيَّ هَذَا الْمَالَ الْمُسَمَّى مَبْلَغُهُ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ فِي نُجُومِهَا فَأَنْتَ حُرٌّ بِهَا لَكَ مَا لِلأَحْرَارِ وَعَلَيْكَ مَا عَلَيْهِمْ فَإِنْ أَخْلَلْتَ شَيْئًا مِنْهُ عَنْ مَحِلِّهِ بَطَلَتِ الْكِتَابَةُ وَكُنْتَ رَقِيقًا لاَ كِتَابَةَ لَكَ وَقَدْ قَبِلْتُ مُكَاتَبَتَكَ عَلَيْهِ عَلَى الشُّرُوطِ الْمَوْصُوفَةِ فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ قَبْلَ تَصَادُرِنَا عَنْ مَنْطِقِنَا وَافْتِرَاقِنَا عَنْ مَجْلِسِنَا الَّذِي جَرَى بَيْنَنَا ذَلِكَ فِيهِ أَقَرَّ فُلاَنٌ وَفُلاَنٌ.
title_ar: بَابُ الْكِتَابَةِ
intro_en:
Allah, the Mighty and Sublime says: "And such of your slaves as seek a writing (of emancipation), give them such writing, if you find that there is good and honesty in them." [An-Nur:33]
This is a contract written by so and so the son of so and so, who is in good health and in full control of his wealth, to his Nubian slave who is called so and so, who at this time is in his possession and owned by him. I have agreed to manumit you in return for three thousand Dirhams, non-counterfeit and weighing seven, to be paid in installments by you over six consecutive years, starting at the beginning of such and such month in such and such year. You will pay me the amount of money stated in this contract in installments, then you will be free in return for that, with the same rights and duties as all free men. If you default on any of these installments, this contract will be null and void, and you will remain a slave with no contract of manumission. I have accepted your contract of manumission based on the conditions stipulated in this contract before we finished talking, and departed from our meeting, which took place between us.
Signed by So-and-so and So-and-So.

title: Tadbir (Leaving Instructions That One's Slave Be Freed After One's Death)
intro: هَذَا كِتَابٌ كَتَبَهُ فُلاَنُ بْنُ فُلاَنٍ لِفَتَاهُ الصَّقَلِّيِّ الْخَبَّازِ الطَّبَّاخِ الَّذِي يُسَمَّى فُلاَنًا وَهُوَ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي مِلْكِهِ وَيَدِهِ إِنِّي دَبَّرْتُكَ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ وَرَجَاءِ ثَوَابِهِ فَأَنْتَ حُرٌّ بَعْدَ مَوْتِي لاَ سَبِيلَ لأَحَدٍ عَلَيْكَ بَعْدَ وَفَاتِي إِلاَّ سَبِيلَ الْوَلاَءِ فَإِنَّهُ لِي وَلِعَقِبِي مِنْ بَعْدِي أَقَرَّ فُلاَنُ بْنُ فُلاَنٍ بِجَمِيعِ مَا فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ طَوْعًا فِي صِحَّةٍ مِنْهُ وَجَوَازِ أَمْرٍ مِنْهُ بَعْدَ أَنْ قُرِئَ ذَلِكَ كُلُّهُ عَلَيْهِ بِمَحْضَرٍ مِنَ الشُّهُودِ الْمُسَمِّينَ فِيهِ فَأَقَرَّ عِنْدَهُمْ أَنَّهُ قَدْ سَمِعَهُ وَفَهِمَهُ وَعَرَفَهُ وَأَشْهَدَ اللَّهَ عَلَيْهِ وَكَفَى بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا ثُمَّ مَنْ حَضَرَهُ مِنَ الشُّهُودِ عَلَيْهِ أَقَرَّ فُلاَنٌ الصَّقَلِّيُّ الطَّبَّاخُ فِي صِحَّةٍ مِنْ عَقْلِهِ وَبَدَنِهِ أَنَّ جَمِيعَ مَا فِي هَذَا الْكِتَابِ حَقٌّ عَلَى مَا سُمِّيَ وَوُصِفَ فِيهِ.
title_ar: بَابُ تَدْبِيرٍ
intro_en:
This is a contract written by so and so the son of so and so the son of so and so, to his Sicilian slave, the baker and cook, who is called so and so, and who at this time is in his possession and owned by him. I have arranged for your manumission following my death, seeking thereby the Face of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, and hoping for His reward. You will be free after I die, and no one will have any control over you after I die, except by way of Al-Wala' (loyalty of a freed slave to his former masters), which will be to me and my descendents after me.
So-and-so the son of So-and-so affirms all that is mentioned in this contract, without compulsion, while in good health, and in full control of his wealth, after all of that was read to him in the presence of the witnesses named therein. He affirmed in their presence that he had heard it, and understood it, and called upon Allah to bear witness to it, and Allah is sufficient as a witness, then the witnesses who were present. So-and-so the Sicilian cook, who is sound in mind and body, affirmed that everything that is stated in this contract is true and correct according to the way it is written.

title: Manumission
intro: هَذَا كِتَابٌ كَتَبَهُ فُلاَنُ بْنُ فُلاَنٍ طَوْعًا فِي صِحَّةٍ مِنْهُ وَجَوَازِ أَمْرٍ وَذَلِكَ فِي شَهْرِ كَذَا مِنْ سَنَةِ كَذَا لِفَتَاهُ الرُّومِيِّ الَّذِي يُسَمَّى فُلاَنًا وَهُوَ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي مِلْكِهِ وَيَدِهِ إِنِّي أَعْتَقْتُكَ تَقَرُّبًا إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ وَابْتِغَاءً لِجَزِيلِ ثَوَابِهِ عِتْقًا بَتًّا لاَ مَثْنَوِيَّةَ فِيهِ وَلاَ رَجْعَةَ لِي عَلَيْكَ فَأَنْتَ حُرٌّ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ وَالدَّارِ الآخِرَةِ لاَ سَبِيلَ لِي وَلاَ لأَحَدٍ عَلَيْكَ إِلاَّ الْوَلاَءَ فَإِنَّهُ لِي وَلِعَصَبَتِي مِنْ بَعْدِي.
title_ar: بَابُ عِتْقٍ
intro_en: This is a contract written by so and so the son of so and so, without compulsion, while he is in good health and in full control of his wealth, in such-and-such month of such and such year, to his Byzantine slave who is called so and so, who at this time is in his possession and owned by him. I have set you free as an act of worship, seeking thereby the great reward of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, granting you complete and definite freedom with no conditions and no right to take you back. You are free for the Face of Allah, and the Hereafter, and neither I nor anyone else has any control over you, except by way of Al-Wala' (loyalty of a freed slave to his former masters), which is to me and my descandents after me.

[1] Al-Furqan 25:48

title: Excuse for not praying in the congregation
title_ar: باب الْعُذْرِ فِي تَرْكِ الْجَمَاعَةِ

title: "Catching the congregation" (when is one regarded As having caught up with the congregation)
title_ar: باب حَدِّ إِدْرَاكِ الْجَمَاعَةِ

title: Repeating a prayer with the congregation when a man has already prayed by himself
title_ar: باب إِعَادَةِ الصَّلاَةِ مَعَ الْجَمَاعَةِ بَعْدَ صَلاَةِ الرَّجُلِ لِنَفْسِهِ

title: Repeating Fajr with the congregation for one who has already prayed on his own
title_ar: باب إِعَادَةِ الْفَجْرِ مَعَ الْجَمَاعَةِ لِمَنْ صَلَّى وَحْدَهُ

title: Repeating a prayer with a congregation after the time for it is over
title_ar: باب إِعَادَةِ الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ ذَهَابِ وَقْتِهَا مَعَ الْجَمَاعَةِ

title: The obligation of prayer is removed from one who offered it in the masjid with the Imam in congregation
title_ar: باب سُقُوطِ الصَّلاَةِ عَمَّنْ صَلَّى مَعَ الإِمَامِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ جَمَاعَةً

title: Rushing to pray
title_ar: باب السَّعْىِ إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ

title: Hastening to pray without rushing unduly
title_ar: باب الإِسْرَاعِ إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ مِنْ غَيْرِ سَعْىٍ

title: Coming to prayer early (before others)
title_ar: باب التَّهْجِيرِ إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ

title: The Disapproval of praying when the iqhmah is said
title_ar: باب مَا يُكْرَهُ مِنَ الصَّلاَةِ عِنْدَ الإِقَامَةِ

title: Concerning one who prays the two (Sunnah) Rak'ahs of fajr while the Imam is leading the prayer
title_ar: باب فِيمَنْ يُصَلِّي رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ وَالإِمَامُ فِي الصَّلاَةِ

title: A person praying alone behind the row
title_ar: باب الْمُنْفَرِدِ خَلْفَ الصَّفِّ

title: Bowing outside the row
title_ar: باب الرُّكُوعِ دُونَ الصَّفِّ

title: Praying after Zuhr
title_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الظُّهْرِ

title: Prayer before Asr and different narrations from Abu Ishaq concerning that
title_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ قَبْلَ الْعَصْرِ وَذِكْرِ اخْتِلاَفِ النَّاقِلِينَ عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ فِي ذَلِكَ

title: What is done at the beginning of the prayer
title_ar: باب الْعَمَلِ فِي افْتِتَاحِ الصَّلاَةِ

title: Raising the hands before saying the takbir
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ قَبْلَ التَّكْبِيرِ

title: Raising the hands in level with the shoulders
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ حَذْوَ الْمَنْكِبَيْنِ

title: Raising the hands parallel to the ears
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ حِيَالَ الأُذُنَيْنِ

title: Location of the thumbs when raising the hands
title_ar: باب مَوْضِعِ الإِبْهَامَيْنِ عِنْدَ الرَّفْعِ

title: Raising the hands, extended
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ مَدًّا

title: Obligation of the first takbir
title_ar: باب فَرْضِ التَّكْبِيرَةِ الأُولَى

title: The saying with which the prayer is begun
title_ar: باب الْقَوْلِ الَّذِي يُفْتَتَحُ بِهِ الصَّلاَةُ

title: Placing the right hand on the left hand during the prayer
title_ar: باب وَضْعِ الْيَمِينِ عَلَى الشِّمَالِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ

title: If the Imam sees a man placing his left hand on his right
title_ar: باب فِي الإِمَامِ إِذَا رَأَى الرَّجُلَ قَدْ وَضَعَ شِمَالَهُ عَلَى يَمِينِهِ

title: The location of the right hand on the left in prayer
title_ar: باب مَوْضِعِ الْيَمِينِ مِنَ الشِّمَالِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ

title: The prohibition of putting one's hand on one's waist when praying
title_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ التَّخَصُّرِ، فِي الصَّلاَةِ

title: Standing with the feet together when praying
title_ar: باب الصَّفِّ بَيْنَ الْقَدَمَيْنِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ

title: The Imam pausing after starting the prayer
title_ar: باب سُكُوتِ الإِمَامِ بَعْدَ افْتِتَاحِهِ الصَّلاَةَ

title: The supplication between the takbir and the recitation
title_ar: باب الدُّعَاءِ بَيْنَ التَّكْبِيرَةِ وَالْقِرَاءَةِ

title: Another supplication between the takbir and recitation
title_ar: باب نَوْعٌ آخَرُ مِنَ الدُّعَاءِ بَيْنَ التَّكْبِيرِ وَالْقِرَاءَةِ

title: Another type of remembrance and supplication between the takbir and recitation
title_ar: باب نَوْعٌ آخَرُ مِنَ الذِّكْرِ وَالدُّعَاءِ بَيْنَ التَّكْبِيرِ وَالْقِرَاءَةِ

title: Another kind of remembrance between the start of the prayer and the recitation
title_ar: باب نَوْعٌ آخَرُ مِنَ الذِّكْرِ بَيْنَ افْتِتَاحِ الصَّلاَةِ وَبَيْنَ الْقِرَاءَةِ

title: Another kind of remembrance after the takbir
title_ar: باب نَوْعٌ آخَرُ مِنَ الذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ التَّكْبِيرِ

title: Starting with Fatihatil-Kitab (The Opening of The Book) before another Surah
title_ar: باب الْبَدَاءَةِ بِفَاتِحَةِ الْكِتَابِ قَبْلَ السُّورَةِ

title: Reciting: "In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful"
title_ar: باب قِرَاءَةِ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ

title: Not saying "In the Name of Allah, The Most Gracious, The Most Merciful" Aloud
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ الْجَهْرِ بِـ ‏{‏ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ ‏}‏

title: Not reciting "In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful" in Al Fatihah
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ قِرَاءَةِ ‏{‏ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ ‏}‏ فِي فَاتِحَةِ الْكِتَابِ

title: The Obligation to recite Fatihatil-Kitab in the prayer
title_ar: باب إِيجَابِ قِرَاءَةِ فَاتِحَةِ الْكِتَابِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ

title: The virtue of Fatihatil-Kitab
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ فَاتِحَةِ الْكِتَابِ

title: The Interpretation of the saying of Allah, The Mighty and Sublime: And Indeed, "We have
title_ar: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ ‏{‏ وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ سَبْعًا مِنَ الْمَثَانِي وَالْقُرْآنَ الْعَظِيمَ ‏}‏

title: Not reciting behind the imam in prayers where he does not recite loudly
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ الْقِرَاءَةِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ فِيمَا لَمْ يَجْهَرْ فِيهِ

title: Not reciting behind the imam in a rak'ah where he recites out loud
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ الْقِرَاءَةِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ فِيمَا جَهَرَ بِهِ

title: Reciting Umm Al-Quran (Al Fatihah) behind the imam in rak'ahs where the imam recites out
title_ar: باب قِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ فِيمَا جَهَرَ بِهِ الإِمَامُ

title: The interpretation of the saying of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime: So, when the Quran is
title_ar: باب تَأْوِيلِ قَوْلِهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ ‏{‏ وَإِذَا قُرِئَ الْقُرْآنُ فَاسْتَمِعُوا لَهُ وَأَنْصِتُوا لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ ‏}‏

title: The Imam's recitation is sufficient for the one who is following him
title_ar: باب اكْتِفَاءِ الْمَأْمُومِ بِقِرَاءَةِ الإِمَامِ

title: What recitation is sufficient for one who cannot recite Quran well
title_ar: باب مَا يُجْزِئُ مِنَ الْقِرَاءَةِ لِمَنْ لاَ يُحْسِنُ الْقُرْآنَ

title: Imam saying Amin out loud
title_ar: باب جَهْرِ الإِمَامِ بِآمِينَ

title: The command to say Amin behind the Imam
title_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِالتَّأْمِينِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ

title: The virtue of saying Amin
title_ar: باب فَضْلِ التَّأْمِينِ

title: What a person should say if he sneezes behind the Imam
title_ar: باب قَوْلِ الْمَأْمُومِ إِذَا عَطَسَ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ

title: Collection of what was narrated concerning the Quran
title_ar: باب جَامِعِ مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقُرْآنِ

title: Recitation in the two rak'ahs of Fajr
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ

title: Reciting: "Say: O you disbelievers" and "Say: He is Allah, (the) One" in the two rak'ahs
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ بِـ ‏{‏ قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ ‏}‏ وَ ‏{‏ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ‏}‏‏

title: Making the two rak'ahs of Fajr brief
title_ar: باب تَخْفِيفِ رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ

title: Reciting (Surat) Ar-Rum in Subh
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الصُّبْحِ بِالرُّومِ

title: Reciting between sixty and one hundred verses in Subh
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الصُّبْحِ بِالسِّتِّينَ إِلَى الْمِائَةِ

title: Reciting (Surah) Qaf in Subh
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الصُّبْحِ بِـ ‏{‏ ق ‏}‏

title: Reciting: "When the sun is wound round" in Subh
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الصُّبْحِ بِـ ‏{‏ إِذَا الشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ ‏}‏‏}‏

title: Reciting Al Mua'awwidhatain in Subh
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الصُّبْحِ بِالْمُعَوِّذَتَيْنِ

title: The virtue of reciting Al-Mu'awwidhatain
title_ar: باب الْفَضْلِ فِي قِرَاءَةِ الْمُعَوِّذَتَيْنِ

title: Recitation in Subh on Friday
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الصُّبْحِ يَوْمَ الْجُمُعَةِ

title: The prostration related to reading quran: the prostration in Sad (38)
title_ar: باب سُجُودِ الْقُرْآنِ السُّجُودِ فِي ص

title: The Prostration in An-Najm (53)
title_ar: باب السُّجُودِ فِي ‏{‏ وَالنَّجْمِ ‏}‏

title: Not prostrating in An-Najm
title_ar: باب تَرْكِ السُّجُودِ فِي النَّجْمِ

title: The Prostration in: "When the heaven is split asunder"
title_ar: باب السُّجُودِ فِي ‏{‏ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْشَقَّتْ ‏}‏

title: Prostration during: "Read! In the Name of your Lord"
title_ar: باب السُّجُودِ فِي ‏{‏ اقْرَأْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ ‏}‏

title: Prostration during obligatory prayers
title_ar: باب السُّجُودِ فِي الْفَرِيضَةِ

title: Recitation (in prayers) during the day
title_ar: باب قِرَاءَةِ النَّهَارِ

title: Recitation in Zuhr
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الظُّهْرِ

title: Making the standing longer in the first rak'ah of Zuhr prayer
title_ar: باب تَطْوِيلِ الْقِيَامِ فِي الرَّكْعَةِ الأُولَى مِنْ صَلاَةِ الظُّهْرِ

title: The Imam saying a verse audibly in Zuhr
title_ar: باب إِسْمَاعِ الإِمَامِ الآيَةَ فِي الظُّهْرِ

title: Making the standing shorter in the second rak'ah of Zuhr
title_ar: باب تَقْصِيرِ الْقِيَامِ فِي الرَّكْعَةِ الثَّانِيَةِ مِنَ الظُّهْرِ

title: Recitation in the first two rak'ahs on Zuhr
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ الأُولَيَيْنِ مِنْ صَلاَةِ الظُّهْرِ

title: Recitation in the first two rak'ahs of 'Asr
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ الأُولَيَيْنِ مِنْ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ

title: Making the standing and recitation lighter
title_ar: باب تَخْفِيفِ الْقِيَامِ وَالْقِرَاءَةِ

title: Reciting the short Mufassal surahs in Maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ بِقِصَارِ الْمُفَصَّلِ

title: Reciting: "Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High" in Maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ بِـ ‏{‏ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الأَعْلَى ‏}‏

title: Reciting Al-Mursalat (77) in Maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ بِالْمُرْسَلاَتِ

title: Reciting At-Tur (52) in Maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ بِالطُّورِ

title: Reciting Ad-Duhkan (44) in Maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ بِـ ‏{‏ حم ‏}‏ الدُّخَانِ

title: Reciting "Alif-Lam-Mim-Sad" in Maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ بِـ ‏{‏ المص ‏}‏

title: Recitation in the two rak'ahs after maghrib
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ بَعْدَ الْمَغْرِبِ

title: The virtue of reciting "Say: He is Allah, (the) One"
title_ar: باب الْفَضْلِ فِي قِرَاءَةِ ‏{‏ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ‏}‏

title: Reciting: "Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High" in Isha'
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ بِـ ‏{‏ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الأَعْلَى ‏}‏

title: Reciting: "By the sun and its brightness" in Isha'
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ بِالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا

title: Reciting "By the fig and the olive" in Isha'
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِيهَا بِالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ

title: Recitation in the first rak'ah of Isha'
title_ar: باب الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الرَّكْعَةِ الأُولَى مَنْ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ

title: Taking one's time in the first two rak'ahs
title_ar: باب الرُّكُودِ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ الأُولَيَيْنِ

title: Reciting two surahs in one rak'ah
title_ar: باب قِرَاءَةِ سُورَتَيْنِ فِي رَكْعَةٍ

title: Reciting part of a surah
title_ar: باب قِرَاءَةِ بَعْضِ السُّورَةِ

title: Reciter seeking refuge with Allah if he recites a verse that mentions punishment
title_ar: باب تَعَوُّذِ الْقَارِئِ إِذَا مَرَّ بِآيَةِ عَذَابٍ

title: Reciter asking Allah when he reaches a verse mentioning mercy
title_ar: باب مَسْأَلَةِ الْقَارِئِ إِذَا مَرَّ بِآيَةِ رَحْمَةٍ

title: Repeating a verse
title_ar: باب تَرْدِيدِ الآيَةِ

title: The saying of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime: "And offer your salah (prayer) neither alou
title_ar: باب قَوْلِهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ ‏{‏ وَلاَ تَجْهَرْ بِصَلاَتِكَ وَلاَ تُخَافِتْ بِهَا ‏}‏

title: Reciting Quran in a loud voice
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الصَّوْتِ بِالْقُرْآنِ

title: Elongating the sounds when reciting Quran
title_ar: باب مَدِّ الصَّوْتِ بِالْقِرَاءَةِ

title: Making one's voice beautiful when reciting Quran
title_ar: باب تَزْيِينِ الْقُرْآنِ بِالصَّوْتِ

title: Saying The Takbir before prostrating
title_ar: باب التَّكْبِيرِ لِلرُّكُوعِ

title: Raising the hands before bowing until they are parallel to the highest part of the ears
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ لِلرُّكُوعِ حِذَاءَ فُرُوعِ الأُذُنَيْنِ

title: Raising the hands parallel to the shoulders before bowing
title_ar: باب رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ لِلرُّكُوعِ حِذَاءَ الْمَنْكِبَيْنِ

title: Not doing that
